loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly M. is from the village of Lumipac, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dolly sells household items and dry goods in the local community. Dolly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Dolly joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolly successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC which she used as additional capital for her business. Dolly is requesting her third loan from PMPC, for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to redeem the pawned land.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned land.

loans.name: Samin's Group

texts.en:
In Kandaol Village in Takeo Province, four people have formed a loan group. Mrs. Samin O. was selected by the other members to be the group leader. Each member of the group will use their portiO. of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Samin O. and her husband, Mr. Ven Vey, are farmers who own a 1.4-hectare (~ 3.5-acre) plot of land where they grow crops to sell so they can  support their family. Now, their problem is that it is time to plow their field, but they do not have enough money to pay for plowing. So, to improve productiO., Mrs. Samin O. is applying for a loan to rent a plow to plow her field. She is the mother of a child who attends the local public school.

loans.use: To rent a plow

loans.name: 040102-Hoằng Trường- Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Kỷ N. thị (40102025) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hoằng Hóa- Thanh hóa.  Kỷ is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa  (40102).

Kỷ is married and has 4 adult children.  To making a living, Kỷ operates a family member's business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Kỷ has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Kỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Kỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Kỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. thị Cài (36) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  T. thị Hường (23) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


3.  N. thị Huyền (21) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  N. thị Thủy (34) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her a fishing business.


5.  N. thị Yên (28) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


6.  Lê thị Liên (26) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


7.  N. Thị Vì (27) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Kỷ N. thị (40102025) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa- Thanh hóa.  Kỷ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa  (40102).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Kỷ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Kỷ kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Kỷ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Kỷ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. thị Cài (36) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  T. thị Hường (23) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. thị Huyền (21) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. thị Thủy (34) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  N. thị Yên (28) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


6.  Lê thị Liên (26) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  N. Thị Vì (27) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred T. is from the village of Lam-an, in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mildred is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a Xerox copier business. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In 2010, Mildred joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional materials that will be use for her Xerox copier. This will be Mildred's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her xerox copier

loans.name: Yulita's Group

texts.en:
Yulita E. is from the village of Sibutad. She is 56 years old. Yulita is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Yulita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Yulita grows and sells rice. Yulita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Yulita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yulita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14500 PHP from PMPC. Yulita is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be Yulita's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has five children. She lives with her family in a mid-sized city called Vehari and her husband sells sweet ice balls to earn a living.  
Najma is very caring for her family. She takes care of her children and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will buy more ice and sweet syrups to expand his business. 

Her children are getting their education, and Najma wishes for them that they might complete their education. She hopes that the investment in her husband’s business will enable her to improve her family's living standards and she will be able to complete her children’s education by sending them to better education centers.

Note: Najma has showed her husband's sweet ice ball business in this photo. Sweet ice balls are well-known by people and specially kids to entertain them in the summer season by putting sweet colors on them.

loans.use: Purchase ice & syrups for her husband's sweet-ice-ball making business

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon C. is the leader of her four-member loan group. She was selected by the members, all of whom live in Trapeang Kralaong Village in Takeo Province. Each member of the loan group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all will try to improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Yon C. was born in 1965. She sells brooms door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Phork Phoung, is farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice that he sells to support his family. With their businesses, this couple supports seven children. Three of their children are seamstresses in a garment factory. The others attend the local public school. Although they all try to work hard, they earn little money, so, to improve the situation, Mrs. Yon C. is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics so she can start a new cosmetics business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Romalyn

texts.en:
Romalyn A. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog city. She is 40 years old. Romalyn is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Romalyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of coco pulp (copras)  in the local community. Romalyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Romalyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Romalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
41-year-old Arlene A. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Described as honest and understanding by family and friends, she makes sure to be a role model to her children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs

texts.en:

To make a living Jennie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jennie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jennie joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennie is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Elsa Beronguez Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa B. is 44 years old, married, and a resident of P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group members receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member if one becomes delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Elsa B. Group.

Elsa is married to Andres B., who is a driver at Naomi's Botanical Garden. They are blessed with 2 children who are now in their mid-teens. To help her husband, she decided to engage in micro business particularly selling RTW (GTY Products).  She has been selling products for 6 months and, at this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,000.00 a month.  The extra money is so helpful to their family's income. Upon hearing the good news that PAGLAUM MPC was recognized as "Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines" in the COOP-LGU Partnership Awards in 2006, she joined the cooperative in the year 2009.

As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P6,000.00 as her 2nd cycle loan to add to her capital for her existing RTW dealing business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments to PMPC, and for possible business expansion.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand existing RTW dealing business

location.town: P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
27-year-old Donna G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She has been married to Vincente for eight years and now has 3 children. She started farming a couple of years ago. She and her husband till their land to plant rice crops. She sells their harvest at the local market. She hopes to invest in raising livestock like pigs and ducks. She says that if she has enough capital to start, she will do it.

Donna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Donna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Donna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Donna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sman

texts.en:
Mrs. N. divorced her husband when her kids were young. She now has six children; one is already married and lives independently, and the remaining children are single. Four of her children are working at different occupations. To earn a living, N. owns and operates her own small business braiding nets and traps. She has two kids who assist her in making tools. N. either sells her item in bulk to middlemen or retails to people who use the tool to fish along the river.

N. says that she is running her business well but that she faces difficulty with transportation. She has dreamed for a long time of having her own vehicle for the purpose of traveling, but she doesn’t have the money to buy one. So, N. will be used this loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has six children who couldn’t get their education due to financial reasons. Her husband is a carpenter by trade and has a business doing furniture-making while Shamim helps her husband by doing embroidery work. She started her embroidery business few years ago with the help of an Asasah loan. 

Shamim’s husband is out of stock these days and as a result is facing losses in his business. She has helped him in this crucial time by working hard in her embroidery business.  

Shamim has applied for the second time for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the loan amount in her husband's business which will allow him to buy woods and nails for the manufacturing of furniture. Shamim hopes that her husband will be able to re-establish his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase required material for furniture-making business

loans.name: 03.04.07 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh Luong T. (15) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).

Thanh is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thanh owns & operates a business a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Hoan (13) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh Luong T. (15) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 4,500,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hoan (13) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

texts.en:
Mizaaj lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan with her family. She has six children; three of them are getting their education while two of the other three work to support their family and one of them is jobless and looking for a job. 

Mizaaj has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah to financially support her husband who sells animals. He has been doing this business for the last thirty-five years. He buys young animals, goats and buffaloes, raises them, and sells them to earn an income. 

With the loan amount, her husband will buy more animals for selling. Mizaaj is hopeful that this investment will give them good returns and improve their living standard.

loans.name: Mrs. Pha Ngan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people who live in Ta Ei village in Takeo province. All the members have been selected and Mrs. Pha N. is a village bank president.  The loan members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their businesses in the future.

Mrs. Pha N. is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sor Miech, is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell and support his family.  He is a fisherman, too. Her problem is that her pigs are too small to sell. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Pha N. is applying for a loan to buy pig food.  WI. the rest of the loan, she will fix her husband’s fishing boat and buy a stream to finding fishes. She is the mother of two children.  One is a tailor, and the other is attending local public school.

All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked.

Three of them attend school and other two are still young. He also has his mother living with him. They are living along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Prum is not in the photo, but his wife was available instead. 

Prum has been a fisherman since 1990. His wife sells flowers and fish that her husband caught at Prek Phnao market, about four kilometers from her house. But, now she has stopped her business for a while because she just delivered a baby. Besides the business, the couple grows rice as well. 

Prum does not have his own boat and the boat that he uses to fish every day belongs to his relative. So he is requesting his first loan of US$ 300 to purchase his own boat.

loans.use: To purchase a boat to use for his fishing business

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Five members who live in Kor village in Takeo province make up this group loan. Mrs. Thol S. is the group leader, selected by the other members; each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thol S. is 32 years old. She is a weaver at her home and she is a pig breeder, too. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Ouch, is a soldier and a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family. 

Now they have a problem because Mrs. Thol S.'s pigs are too small to sell. So Mrs. Thol S. is asking for a loan to buy pig feed; with the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children all of whom are studying in local public schools.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Maria Annie

texts.en:
Maria Annie M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Maria Annie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Annie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Annie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Annie is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Annie Marie

texts.en:
Annie Marie D. is from the city of Opao, Dapitan. She is 41 years old. Annie Marie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annie Marie owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling hollow blocks to local businesses and community members. Annie Marie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Annie Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 70,000 PHP from PMPC. Annie Marie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Annie Marie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat S. is a villager in Angk Sangkae village in Takeo province, and she was born in 1959. Now she and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Chum, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Their difficulty is that their field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophat S. is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed, and gasoline. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a car driver, while another is a motorbike taxi driver, and the others are studying in local public schools. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed, and gasoline

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (shown in the picture), age 39 and her husband, Mr. Heang Uk, age 36, have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is in school; another one stays at home, and her son is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap has been selling soup in Phnom Penh for over a year. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for five years. Her son who is a garment factory worker does not have transportation; it’s difficult for him because he often spends a lot of money for traveling costs. So, Sopheap is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle T. is from the village of Bularan, Miputak. She is 49 years old. Anabelle is married, has one school-aged and one infant child. To make a living, Anabelle owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish and dried fish in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Anabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann M., who lives in Srei Chey village in Takeo province, is 38 years old. She has two positions: she is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family, and she owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money to support her family. 

Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sarann M. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries for resale. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a pure water seller, while the other is studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a rice farm that her husband manages. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Helen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies

loans.name: Berlie

texts.en:
Berlie C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 28 years old. Berlie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Berlie owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products including hand and body lotions and perfumes in the local community. Berlie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Berlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Berlie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Berlie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: 04.01.01-Hoang Truong 2-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Viên Lê Thị (12) is a 56 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa. Viên is the group leader of a 0-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa (040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa).

Viên is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To making a living, Viên operates a family-run fishing business. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Viên has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND per month from these activities.


In 2002, Viên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Viên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase more fishing equipment including hooks & nets. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Viên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê thị Trọng (30) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  Lê thị Tích (17) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3.  Nguyễn thị Cúc (33) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  Phạm thị Liên (31) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  Lê thị Thu (35) is a 25 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Minh (16) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

7.  Lê thị Chiến (14) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

8.  Lê Phạm thị Hợp (22) is a 21 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Viên Lê Thị (12) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa.  Viên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 0 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa (040101- Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Viên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Viên kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Viên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Viên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6000000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 10th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê thị Trọng (30) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
