loans.use: To purchase pants, jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz I. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Luz is married and has 4 school-aged children. Luz owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr:
Jeune femme âgée de 34ans ,mère de 2 enfants, vendant le poisson salé en détail depuis 4ans, celibataire, elle a la charge de ses enfants et ceux laissés par sa defunte soeur.
elle achète son poisson en gros dans les marchés et elle vend en moyenne 30000f par jour,la présentation de son produit,le choix de la qualité et sa gentillesse, font d'elle une battante.
L'actuel prêt lui permettra d'achéter les cartons de thon, crovine, capitaine et un sac de crévettes.
Diversifier son Produit sur son étalage,attirera plus de clients et cela va lui générer des bénéfices et accroitre son actvité

Pour l'avenir, elle voudrait assurer une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.Sa vision est qu'elle soit 
grossiste afin de raviller ses amies.
texts.en:
A young woman of 34 and mother of 2 has sold salted fish for the past four years. Unmarried, she has custody of her children as well as those of her late sister. She buys her fish in bulk in the markets and sells an average of 30000f per day. The presentation of her product, quality of her selection and her kindness make her a go-getter. This loan will allow her to buy cartons of tuna, croaker, perch and a bag of prawns. By diversifying her window display she will attract more clients which can generate more profit and increase her activity. For the future she would like to ensure a good education for her children. Her vision is to become a wholesaler in order to supply her friends.

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a carton of salted fish like tuna, cod, crovine and prawns

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: O. Fatima est née en 1954 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Fatima est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Fatima vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Il y a environs une vingtaine d'année que Fatima s'est installée au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fatima n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Fatima vend divers produits (sucre, piles, savons, bougies, insecticides, huile végétale,  etc.) à son domicile. Fatima s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Fatima est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Fatima désire développer davantage son activité et l'agrandir, afin de mieux faire face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Fatima sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Fatima O. was born in 1954 in Adjohoun, in the department of Oueme. Fatima is a widow and mother to five children, all in school and still under her care. Fatima lives together with her children and is the sole provider for their expenses. For about twenty years Fatima has lived in the quarter of Gankpodo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Fatima did not go to school. To maintain the various expenses and support the needs of her children, Fatima sells diverse products (sugar, batteries, soap, candles, insecticide, vegetable oil, etc...) from her home. Fatima stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Fatima is a past client of Alidé, having already received five loans which have all been repaid. Fatima wants to further develop and expand her business in order to better respond to the numerous requests of her clientele which is why she is seeking another credit from Alidé

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (cartons of soap and sugar, cans of vegetable oil, candles, batteries, etc...)

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en:
Ma. Chita P. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Ma. Chita is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ma. Chita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ma. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to invest in expanding the business. Ma. Chita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Ma. Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona agrícola de la región, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y la ganadería, se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de personas en la zona, el se dedica a la agricultura, lleva trabajando mas de 10 años en el rubro. Trabaja en un terreno heredado de su padre, allí siembra todo tipo de granos, especialmente de maíz. Esta actividad le permite agenciarse de ingresos con los cuales se encarga del mantenimiento de su familia. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola y con esta actividad percibe ingresos extra.

Julio desea que su cultivo tenga una buena producción, por ello trabaja arduamente para lograr su objetivo. Actualmente desea adquirir abonos y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y para ayudarse, ha decidido  solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Julio es alguien conocido en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es tener éxito en su actual cosecha y en las cosechas futuras para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is a 35 year old father. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Nueva Arica, an agricultural area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. His principal occupations are agriculture and livestock farming. Like the majority of people in the area, he works in agriculture and has spent over ten years working in this occupation. He works on land inherited from his father. He plants all types of grains, particularly corn. Working on the farm provides him with income to support his family. He also earns extra income working as a farm laborer. Julio wants to have a good production of crops and works arduously to achieve his goal. Currently, he wants to buy fertilizer and pesticides to help him maintain his crops. He is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This is his first loan. Julio is well-known in the area. His neighbors consider him to be a hard-working and responsible person. His greatest desire is to have success with his harvest and with future harvests so that his family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain corn crops.

loans.name: Finagnon

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, D. Finagnon vit depuis une trentaine d’année au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Finagnon est une célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Finagnon vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Finagnon n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de dix sept ans, Finagnon mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves de tomates, de sardine, lait, pâtes alimentaires, couscous, riz, savons, papier hygiénique, produits cosmétiques, etc.) à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à se prendre en charge et à améliorer son niveau de vie. Finagnon achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Finagnon est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu quatre prêts auprès de ALIDé, et qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Finagnon désire renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est donc pour rehausser son stock de produits que Finagnon sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Finagnon D. has lived in the Kpondehou quarter of Cotonou for twenty years. Finagnon is not married and does not yet have any children. Finagnon lives alone and is solely responsible for her living expenses. Finagnon did not go to school. For nearly seventeen years Finagnon has sold diverse products (canned tomatoes, sardines, milk, pasta, couscous, rice, soap, toilet paper, cosmetics, etc...) from her home. This business earns her a profit, helping her to take care of herself and improve her quality of life. Finagnon buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Finagnon is a past client of Alidé, having obtained four previous loans which were all repaid. Facing the increasing requests of her clientele, Finagnon wants to increase her business and respond better to the demand. So, Finagnon is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé in order to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products (pasta, canned foods, soap, vegetable oil, cosmetics)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Yolanda owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Yvette est mariée à KOTIN Célestin, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a une trentaine d’année que Yvette s’est installée au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Yvette apporte une aide financière à son mari dans les dépenses familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Yvette vend en effet, des tissus, des produits cosmétiques et des bassines et seaux en plastiques, par le système de distribution. Yvette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est depuis une dizaine d’année que Yvette mène cette activité, et elle a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la concurrence, Yvette sollicite un troisième crédit pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. H. Yvette is married to Mr. KOTIN Célestin, a mechanic. The couple have three children, who are all in school. About thirty years ago, she settled in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou. She lives together with her husband and children. She helps out her husband financially in meeting family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. Yvette basically sells cloth, cosmetics, and plastic tubs and buckets through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and has been in this business for about ten years. She has already had two loans from ALIDé that she repaid. With the goal of elevating her level of business and to cope better with the competition, Yvette is requesting a third loan to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and plastic tubs and buckets

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor es un hombre trabajador de 34 años de edad, comparte su vida con su esposa Doris de la misma edad y sus hijos 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El posee una tienda, que junto a su esposa lograron instalar su propio negocio, es así que todas las tardes atiende a sus clientes, ya que por las mañanas trabaja en un local de venta de ladrillos. En un inicio la tienda no le daba la rentabilidad que deseaban, debido a que en la zona en donde vive no es muy concurrida, ante esto desea solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un motocarro con el cual pueda trabajar de manera  independiente y sacar los ingresos necesarios para progresar. Héctor se percató que sus amigos, quienes se dedican a este negocio le han dado buenos resultados económicos, lo cual lo motiva a concretar su objetivo. Es por ello que espera tener éxito y así consolidarse como un gran microempresario pues si el negocio resulta como espera en un futuro podría comprar otra moto para ponerla a trabajar. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, siendo siempre muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, espera poder cubrir los gastos para comprar un motocarro y así ponerse a trabajar.
texts.en:
Héctor is a hardworking gentleman who is 34 years of age. He shares his life with his wife Doris, who is the same age, and their four children. They live together in their own home. Héctor has a store that both he and his wife manage. In the afternoons, he helps attend to customers after he finishes his job in the morning selling bricks. At first his store was not as profitable as he wanted since he lives in an area that is not very crowded. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a “motocarro” (motorcycle taxi) so that he can work independently and earn the income he needs to make progress. Héctor noticed that his friends who were in this business experienced good financial results, so this motivated him to pursue this goal. He hopes to be successful and establish himself as a great micro-entrepreneur. In the future, he wants to buy another motocarro to put to work.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Héctor has been prompt with all of his payments. With this loan he hopes to cover the costs needed to buy a motocarro so that he can begin working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya B Group, Mubende

texts.en:
When you have a commercial farming business that deals in produce like maize, bananas and beans in any part of this country you are guaranteed a reliable and steady flow of profits. For the last seven years, 57-year-old B. Thomas has seen this for himself. It is for this reason that he has tried to advise his children, especially those finishing university, to try their hand at commercial farming instead of spending years looking for jobs.

Thomas’s farm is in Kibalinga, Mubende. He was a subsistence farmer who later came to terms with the fact that he could improve his and his family's circumstances if he could gravitate towards commercial farming. In a month, he now makes profits that add up to 250,000 shillings.

On the acquisition of this loan, Thomas is planning on purchasing more profitable crops like coffee, millet and maize that he will later resell.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk crops like coffee, millet and maize to resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benjamin Richard

texts.fr:
jeune homme de 46 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 15 ans.Il ya de cela dix ans qu'il gere un parking et lavage  des voitures, autos et cars.Sa recette journaliere est de 15.000fs a 20.000frs par jours.
Avec ce pret va acheter un Kracher avec eau a pression  pour laver les vehicules, des tuyaux,aspirateurs,peaux de chameaux et un extincteur pour ameliorer la qualite de son travail et avoir plus de possibilites pour renforcer et maintenir l'entretien de son parking.
Pour arriver a cela , il preuve d'une bonne et rigoureuse gestion et fait aussi montre d'une bonne surveillance.
Dans l'avenir il pense agrandir son activite en modernisant la qualite des ses services et ouvrir une grande station service , construire une bache a eau en cas de coupure  d'eau chose tres frequente dans le quartier ou est il est installe. Tres entreprenant il epargne un peu plus d'argent pour payer les etudes des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benjamin Richard N. is a young, 46 year-old bachelor with 2 children, 15 and 16 years of age. He has managed a parking lot and car wash for ten years. His revenue ranges from 15,000 frs to 20,000 frs per day. With this loan he is going to purchase a Karcher (pressure washer) to wash vehicles, hoses, vacuum cleaners, chamois, and a fire extinguisher to improve the quality of his work and to have more opportunities for expanding and maintaining his parking lot. In order to achieve that, he has proof of good and rigorous management and also evidence of good supervision. He is thinking of increasing his business in the future by modernizing the quality of his services and opening a large service station, building a water tank in case the water is cut off, a frequent event in the neighborhood where he is located. Very enterprising, he saves a little more money to pay for the education of his children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pressure washer, hoses, vacuum cleaner, chamois and detergents

loans.name: Vihoede Akouvi

texts.en: Vihoede K. is 45 years old and works as a seamstress out of her home in Lomé. As a widow with two children, she must work in order to provide an income for herself and her children. To create her dresses and other clothing, she must purchase sewing supplies like thread and fabric. It is for this reason she has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Constantita

texts.en:
Constantita C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 and married with four adult children. To make a living, Constantita buys and sells scrap metals, junk appliances, used bottles and empty plastic containers from neighboring villages and sells it to the junk shops in the local community. Constantita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Constantita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used additional working capital. Constantita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more scrap items to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Constantita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more scraps items to sell

loans.name: Glenou Kossi

texts.en: Mr. Glenou A. is 53 years old and married to a hairdresser. They have one child. He works as an electrician visiting his clients as they need him, which he’s done since 2003. He is a skilled electrician with experience taking loans from WAGES. This will be his fourth loan, this time in the amount of 400,000 CFA that he’ll use to purchase materials he uses to fix electronics.

loans.use: materials for electronics repair

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya A Group, Mubende

texts.en:
N. Aisha has operated her produce sales stall, that has mostly been dealing in maize and beans, for the last five years in Kibalinga, Mubende. With a farming background, she has found the going not so hard as she has been obtaining a steady supply of crops to sell. Before all this, she was also into a retail business.

This married mother of three has effectively provided for her family out of savings from her business and all her kids are in school. With this loan, she is aiming at purchasing more valuable crops like sorghum that she says will bring her more profits.

loans.use: To purchase crops like sorghum, millet and coffee to sell

loans.name: Milyene

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 38ans célibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 7ans.Commencee très jeune dans la vente de légumes et fruits ,elle excerce cette activité avec enthousiaste, car sa grande mère l'avait initiée à le faire.elle va s'approvisionner très tôt chaque matin dans les marchés ou les fruits viennent de l'interieur du pays.
ses clients sortent de différentes quartier, car son lieu d'activité est un caréfour.
Avec le prêt ,elle compte achéter une grande quantité de fruits de qualités, c'est pendant la saison sèche que les ventes sont meilleures.
ces ventes journalieres varient entre 25000f et 15000f.
Elle veut aider ses soeurs à faire comme elle et soutenir plutard sa fille  de 7ans à etudier dans les bonnes écoles de la ville.
texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old unmarried woman who has two children, varying in age from 2 to 7 years.  Having started at an early age in the selling of fruit and vegetables, she operates this business enthusiastically because her grandmother had introduced her to it.  She is going to stock up very early every morning at the markets, where the fruit arrives from the country's interior.  Her customers come from different districts because her place of business is a crossroad.  With this loan, she intends to buy a large quantity of quality fruit.  Sales are better during the dry season.  These daily sales vary from 15,000 to 24,000 francs.  She would like to help her sisters do as she does and to support her 7-year-old daughter later on with attending the right schools in the city. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables in season

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Marivic is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wood & wood-related products in the local community. Marivic is also selling hollow blocks. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fraternidad inicia su quinto ciclo, todas las socias son del Barrio D. Enace Vista Alegre, muchas D. ellas se conocen y son vecinas.
Rosa es la presidenta del Banco Comunal desD. la formación del mismo, su alegría y responsabilidad hace que las socias la nombren en reiteradas veces como la líder del Banco Comunal. Rosa es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 4 hijos estudian, Rosa es enfermera D. profesión actividad que dejo D. realizar para dedicarse al cuidado D. sus hijos, Rosa venD. leña en su casa, productos que adquiere D. los productores, negocio que realiza con ayuda D. sus hijos, además Rosa en algunas oportunidades viaja a las diferentes ferias en donD. compra cereales, productos que luego los procesa y hace moler en un molino alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados. Rosa solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada.
Durante el tiempo que es socia en Finca Perú aprendió a ahorrar, ser responsable y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The community bank Banco Comunal Fraternidad is currently in its fifth cycle of microlending. All of the members are from the Barrio D. Enace Vista Alegre. Many of them know each other, and some are even neighbors. Rosa has been the president of Banco Comunal since its formation, and her cheerfulness and responsibility have led the members to consistently re-elect her as the bank's leader. Rosa is married and has five children (of whom four are students). Rosa is a nurse by profession, but she left that work in order to look after her children. Now Rosa sells firewood from her home, as well as other products that she gets from suppliers. Her children help her to carry out this work. In addition to her sales, Rosa also at times will travel to the different regional fairs where she purchases grain products that can be later processed in a rented mill, and sold to vendors from varous local markets. Rosa requests a loan of 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley. During the time in which she was a member of Finca Perú, she learned to save money and be responsible. What she most enjoys about working with a communal bank are the meetings, where she gets to see the other members with whom she is freinds. Her dream is to grow her business and for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo, cebada.

loans.name: Segundo Anastacio

texts.es:
Don Segundo es casado con 2 hijos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la ciudad de San Ignacio, en el centro de la ciudad cuenta con un copetín y hamburguesería donde todos los días trabaja con su señora y sus hijos.
El solicita un  crédito para adquirir más mercaderías como carne, panificados, mayonesas, condimentos, y otros con el fin ampliar la disponibilidad de comidas rápidas en su local.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por el trabajo que está realizando ya que mediante ingreso él puede mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is married with 2 children, and lives with them and his wife in the city of San Ignacio. He has a fast food stand in the center of the city where he works every day with his wife and children. He is requesting a loan to buy more supplies like meat, bread, mayonnaise, condiments, and others in order to expand the availability of fast food at his stand. The client expresses his satisfaction with his work since it maintains his family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, condiments, mayonnaise, bread and others

loans.name: Akoko Antoinette

texts.en: Akoko Antoinette W. is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who works selling onions. Although she is quite young she has been working for about five years. She is married to a man who works transporting merchandise. They have one child. Mrs. W. has requested her first loan from WAGES microfinance in the amount of 200,000 CFA to purchase more onions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase onions to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela es propietaria de una despensa y mercería en el barrio Yatayty de la ciudad de  Ayolas, es madre soltera con una nena menor de edad. 
Es una mujer luchadora que se esmera en brindarle lo mejor a su hija, con su esfuerzo lleva adelante su negocio en su casa.
 Ella accedió al crédito con la Fundación para adquirir más mercaderías y mercerías como; medias, bufandas, guantes, gorras, panificados, productos de limpieza, enlatados, etc.
texts.en:
Angela owns a small grocery store in the Yatayty neighborhood in the city of Ayolas. She is a single mom to a young girl. She is a determined woman who strives to give her daughter the best, and who through great effort succeeds with a business in her home. She requested a loan through the Foundation to purchase more goods and merchandise such as, socks, scarves, caps, baked goods, cleaning supplies, canned goods etc.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase socks, scarves, caps, baked goods, cleaning supplies, canned goods etc

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: D. Jeannette est née le 06 Juin 1976 et est mariée à BEDOU Raoul, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeannette s’est installée avec son mari et leurs enfants au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs quinze ans. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Jeannette vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Jeannette achète ses produits aussi à Dantokpa. Jeannette exerce cette activité depuis treize ans environs et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Jeannette désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et accroître sa clientèle pour se faire plus de revenus ; c’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Jeannette was born on June 6, 1976 and is married to Mr. BEDOU Raoul, a merchant.  The couple have three children who are all in school.  Along with her husband, she settled in the Avotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, about fifteen years ago.  The couple jointly provide for their family.  To support herself, Jeannette sells second-hand clothing in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She buys her goods at Dantokpa too.  She has been in this business for about thirteen years and has already had four loans, which have all been repaid.  Jeannette would like to raise her level of business and grow her customer base in order to bring in more revenue.  This is what has lead her to request a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Kyaterekera United Group, Mubende

texts.en:
At the top left corner in the small photo is N. Jane as she also appears in the big group photo)

Her main source of income for the past 20 years has been selling crops like maize, beans and groundnuts (peanuts) in Mubende town. It is with savings from this business that hardworking N. Jane has managed to sustain her family of eight children.

The 43-year-old dynamic business lady has reached a point where profits accruing to her business now amount to 100,000 Ugandan shillings each week. After reaching a point where she was harvesting most of her crops in bulk, she had surplus most of the time. She therefore reasoned she could sell some to earn income. She also runs a bar business from where she makes her additional earnings.

With this loan, Jane says she is going to purchase more crops that she will later sell at her stall.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk to sell at her stall

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 43 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 14 y 18 años de edad en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La separación de su esposo le motivó a trabajar para ganarse el sustento de sus hijas. Se dedica principalmente a la comercialización de animales: todos los miércoles viaja hacia los caseríos de la zona y compra aves de corral (patos, pavos) que luego vende a los comerciantes de carne del mercado de la ciudad. Ella sacrifica a las aves y las vende listas para ser comercializadas. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de su familia.

De otro lado se dedica a la preparación y venta de vino. Empezó en este negocio hace dos años gracias a que una de sus hijas aprendió el oficio en el colegio donde estudiaba. Marcela fermenta la bebida en baldes de plástico y las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos.

Marcela ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Kiva y con el préstamo que se le otorgó anteriormente pudo hacer progresar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, ahora se mantiene viajando constantemente a los caseríos para adquirir animales y seguir comercializándolos. La necesidad de agenciarse de nuevos ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijas ha hecho que solicite nuevamente a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la adquisición de mas animales para ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias.

Ella es una madre que siempre da todo de sí para sacar a sus hijas adelante. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su dos hijas convertidas en profesionales exitosas. En el préstamo anterior ella ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Marcela is 43, separated and lives with her two daughters ages 14 and 18 in the San Martin area of the city of Lambayeque, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Separating from her husband drove her to to work to maintain her daughters. She makes a living mainly through selling animals. Every Wednesday she travels to the rural communities in the area and buys poultry (ducks, turkeys) that she then resells to the meat sellers in the city market. She butchers the animals herself and sells them ready for resale. This business is her main source of income. Another business is making and selling wine. She started this business two years ago thanks to the fact that her daughter learned the process in high school. Marcela ferments the beverage in plastic buckets and then sells it to neighbors and acquaintances. Marcela has worked with Kiva before, her last loan helped build her business and increase her sales. Today she travels constantly to the rural communities to buy animals and resell them. Her need to increase her income to help her daughters succeed is why she is requesting and loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles through Edpyme Alternativa, to invest in the purchase of more animals to increase her sales. She is mother who always gives everything to help her daughters succeed. Her greatest wish is to see her two daughters become successful professionals. She has shown punctuality and responsibility in the repayment of her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals for resale to the local market

loans.name: Yawoa

texts.en: Yawoa A. is 42 years old and lives in her hometown of Lomé. She sells purses, luggage, and other bags. Her husband transports merchandise for a living. They have four children. To add to her family’s income, Mrs. A. works selling these bags, which she has done since 1998. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 CFA in order to purchase more bags to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, D. Odette vit depuis près de huit ans au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Odette est mariée à TOVICHELE Germain, un chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Odette vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les charges de la famille sont supportés ensemble par Odette et son mari. Odette a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Odette  vend des pommes fruits et des raisins à Cotonou. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Odette achète ses produits. C'est la première fois que Odette sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son capital et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Odette D. has been living for nearly eight years in the Abokicodji district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Odette is married to Germain Tovitchele, a driver. They have a child attending school; they all live together. The household expenses are borne by both Odette and her husband. Odette did not much attend school. For about ten years, she has been selling apples and grapes in Cotonou. Odette gets her supplies in the neighboring country of Nigeria. She is requesting financial help from Alidé for the first time, in order to increase her capital and her stock of goods, to her customers better satisfaction.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing apples in crates

loans.name: Anani Ablavé

texts.en: Anami A. is 48 years old and has a small restaurant in Lomé, called “L’Ange Bleu,” or “Blue Angel.” She takes care of her two children on her own. She’s only had her restaurant for a year and is requesting her first microloan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA to purchase supplies and food for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Kijongobya Tweyambe Group, Mubende

texts.en:
With hard work and high self-esteem, K. Merab, aged 50 years, has effectively maintained her retail shop for the last ten years. She has mostly been selling rice and other small domestic items that are regularly used in homes.

Merab began this business with the little capital that she had saved from her farming business. For this married mother of seven, things have not always been easy but she has relied on not only her hard work but also support from friends to withstand the challenges.

In a week, Merab makes 100,000 shillings or more, depending on many factors. With this loan, she is keen on purchasing more retail items such as rice, sugar, salt and soap.

Merab is the lady with a green veil wrapped around her head and she belongs to a group of other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar and soap

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en: Mrs. Kayi E. works in her home town of Lomé. She sells cloth and fabrics. She is 44 years old and widowed with three children, thus it is necessary that she continue this work and grow her profits in order to provide for her family. She’s been selling fabrics for 20 years, yet this is her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 400,000 CFA in order to purchase more fabric to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.en: Mr. Fousseni A. is a policeman who sells stamps to make some money. He is 44 years old, married, and they have 3 children. As a policeman, he is charged with giving legal authorization to citizens, which is done by stamping papers or applications with various stamps. Mr. A. sells the stamps themselves on the side to make some extra money to help him care for his young family. He is requesting a loan of 360,000 CFA in order to purchase more stamps.

loans.use: To purchase stamps

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mil F. lo conforman personas féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas las cuales se conocen desde hace tiempo lo que les permite ser un buen equipo que se apoyan entre sí. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ángela María L. J. propietaria de una pequeña venta la cual inicio en el 2005 y  ha ido surtiendo por medio de los préstamos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Teresa
texts.en:
The Mil F. (1000 Flowers) group is made up of hard-working, diligent and dedicated people who have known each other for a long time thus allowing them to work well as a team for they support each other.  The group leader is Ángela María L. J. who has had a small store since 2005 and has been able to stock it thanks to the loans.

The other group members are:  María Teresa

loans.use: For basic grains, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Goussi

texts.en: Mrs. Goussi D. sells cereals in her home town of Lomé. She’s been selling cereals since 2005 and is now taking her first loan from WAGES. She is 37 years old and married to a printer. They have one child. Mrs. D. uses her income from selling cereals to help support her family and the raising of her child. She has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA to purchase more grains to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to resell

loans.name: Bossèdé

texts.fr: D. Bossèdé est née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à TOVINOUNDO Dénakpo, Bossèdé  est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Bossèdé vit avec sa famille au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Bossèdé vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges familiales, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Bossèdé vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, savons, vinaigrette, huile végétale, produits de soins, couscous, etc.) au marché Gbogbanou à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Bossèdé vend des pommes fruits et des raisins. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Bossèdé achète ses produits. Bossèdé a déjà bénéficié d'un prêt de ALIDé, prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et aussi de renforcer son commerce de vente de pommes fruits, Bossèdé sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Bossèdé D. was born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Dénakpo TOVINOUNDO and the mother of four children, all attending school. Bossèdé lives with her family in the Abokicodji district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bossèdé is supporting her husband by sharing the household expenses, thanks to the income deriving from her activity. Bossèdé sells various items (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, soap, vinaigrette, vegetable oil, care products, couscous, etc.) on Gogbanou market in Cotonou. Besides, Bossèdé also sells apples and grapes. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Bossèdé already received a loan from Alidé, which she repaid well. In order to enlarge her business and also to strengthen her sales of apples, Bossèdé is requesting a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various items (care products, couscous, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 42 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes; la socia estudió solo hasta segundo de secundaría, dejando sus estudios se dedico a trabajar desde muy pequeña porque sus padres no podían seguir educándola, ella vive en S se dedicó al trabajo familiar, a la crianza de cuyes y a la venta de estos mismos, La socia también ayuda en la agricultura a sus hermanos cuidando los terrenos que sus padres les encargaron y cultivan papa, maíz, hortalizas y dependiendo a la época todo tipo de productos típicos de nuestra región. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores (cuyes), también arreglará las jaulas y comprará alfa alfa. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She lives in the Angostura district of the Saylla province, departament of Cuzco. The member is named Isabel. She is 42 years old and a single mother of two teenage children. Isabel went to school up to the second year of secondary school and left to work at a young age because her parents couldn't afford to educate her anymore. She started to work in the family business, raising and selling guinea pigs. She also helps her siblings farm the land that their parents gave them to manage. They grow potatoes, corn, greens and all types of regional products depending on the season. Isabel is asking for the loan to invest in buying small animals (guinea pigs). She will also fix their cages and buy alfalfa. Isabel values and is infinitely grateful for loan since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She is also committed to making her payments according to the agreed upon schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy small animals (guinea pigs). She will also fix their cages and buy alfalfa.

loans.name: El Granito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Granito es un nuevo grupo conformado por Johana Cruz M., Denis Francisco García y Agustín Tercero T.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora M. de 42 años quien desde el 2005 se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como cuajadas, queso, leche, crema los cuales trae del norte del país.

Ella inicio con la venta de pocos productos actualmente vende ente 500 a 600 cuajadas semanales ya que distribuye a distintos tramos del mercado. Mendosa asegura que esto es gracias al apoyo familiar que tiene ya que su esposo e hijos trabajan hombro a hombro junto con ella.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Denis Francisco García quien desde hace 8 años vende granos básicos y Agustín Tercero T.  se dedica al comercio de ropa en especial calcetas, calzonetas, chores, camisetas etc.
texts.en:
The Granito (Little Grain) group is newly formed. Its members are: Johana Cruz M., Denis Francisco García and Agustín Tercero T.. Mrs. M., 42, is group leader. She has sold dairy products like, cuajada (a cottage cheese-like cheese), cheese, milk and cream since 2005; she brings the merchandise from the north of the country. She started out selling just a few products but today she sells between 500 and 600 cuajadas per week because she distributes them along several aisles in the market. She states that this is possible thanks to the help she gets from her family since her husband and children work shoulder to shoulder with her. The other group members are: Denis Francisco García who has sold basic grains for the past 8 years and Agustín Tercero T. who sells clothing, especially socks, underwear, shorts, t-shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted dairy products.

loans.name: Faouziath

texts.fr: Née en 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Faouziath vit depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou. Faouziath n'est pas encore marié et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Faouziath vit donc seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Faouziath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Faouziath mène comme activité, la vente d'habits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Faouziath s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Faouziath mène cette cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé. Faouziath a bien effectué les remboursements. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Faouziath sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième prêt, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Faouziath A. has been living for about twelve years in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou. She is still single and childless. So Faouziath is living alone and copes for her various expenses by herself. She did not attend school. In order to provide for her needs, Faouziath is selling clothes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo. Faouziath has been running this business for over 7 years, and already obtained four loans from Alidé, which she repaid well. Due to the increasing demand from her customers, Faouziath is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé, in order to better satisfy her customers and to increase her income.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ready-made garments

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 66 años que vive junto a su esposa y su único hijo soltero en el sector Santa Rosa de Curvan, una zona rural dedicada netamente a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura, el tiene un terreno de cultivo en donde ha sembrado árboles frutales, especialmente Mango y Limón, los frutos de estos árboles los vende por temporadas a algunas fábricas que procesan estos productos para exportarlos a diversos países.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, el cría sus ovejas en corrales ubicados cerca a su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia y también a sus vecinos. Estas actividades son las unicas que le generan ingresos por lo que ha luchado diariamente por mantenerlas durante todo este tiempo.

Manuel desea mejorar la alimentación de sus ovejas para que estas se desarrollen de mejor modo y pueda percibir mayores ingresos al momento de venderlas, para realizar esta acción ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Manuel es un padre responsable y entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le respetan y consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Manuel, 66, is the head of his family, living with his wife and their unmarried son in Santa Rosa de Curvan, a rural agricultural zone in the Tambogrande district, Piura province and region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked for many years in agricultural work. He has planted his land with fruit trees, especially mango and lemon. He sells the fruit seasonally to various factories that process them for export to various countries. In addition, he raises and sells sheep, raising them in corrals near his home and selling them to agents who frequently come as well as to his neighbors. These are his only income-producing activities, which he struggles daily to maintain. Manuel wants to improve the feed of his sheep to improve their development and gain increased income from their sale. For this reason he has requested his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $375. Manuel is a responsible father devoted to his family, known, respected and trusted by his neighbors in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Aydelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aydalina del Carmen L. G. mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella en su niñez aprendió de sus padres el oficio de la zapatería y el cual ha continuado con la creación de su propio taller junto con su esposo hace ocho años aproximadamente. Este es un negocio familiar donde su pareja y sus dos hijos se dedican a la creación del producto mientras ella lo comercializa.  

L. inicio en Adim hace años en un grupo solidario y fue promocionada a crédito individual por su comportamiento crediticio y el crecimiento que obtuvo en ese tiempo. Ella invertirá el crédito en la producción de cajuelas y calzado fino que son los más cotizados en esta época del año. El  sueño de esta mujer excepcional es hacer más grande su taller y lograr tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
Aydalina del Carmen L. G. is a hard-working, dedicated, enterprising woman. While still a child she learned cobbling skills from her parents and to date has worked with her husband in her own shoe shop for about 8 years. This is the family business where her spouse and two children are in charge of manufacturing the items that she is in charge of selling. She first started collaborating with Adim several years ago as a member of a communal bank but was promoted to individual borrower status thanks to her credit history and the growth she obtained during that time. She will use the loan for boot and fine shoe production which are the items in highest demand during this season of the year. This exceptional woman’s dream is to expand her workshop and to have her own sales area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like: leather, soles, insoles, adhesive, thread, etc.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Abelina; ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es soltera la socia se dedica a la administración Hotelera, ella administra un hostal en la ciudad del Cusco y también tiene una tienda abarrotes,  La socia deja a su mamá cuando ella está trabajando en el hostal y cuando tiene tiempo libre ella está a cargo de su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y de esta forma implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She lives in the Angostura district of the Saylla province, departament of Cuzco. The member is named Abelina. She is 27 years old and single. She works in hotel management. She manages a hostal in the city of Cuzco and she also has a grocery store. Abelina drops her mother off when she is working at the hostal and in her free time she runs the grocery store. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise and in this way outfit her grocery store. Abelina values and is infinitely grateful for the loan. It allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy merchandise to outfit her grocery store.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en: Edoh A. is a 50-year-old woman who works selling charcoal. She has two children and is married, but her husband doesn’t work. She started this business in 1995 and has been working hard to provide for her family ever since. Now, she has requested her first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Koffi Albert

texts.en: Koffi Albert A. is 37 years old and has a business selling phone cards in Lomé. This is a good business, as cell phone plans here in Togo are recharged by purchasing minutes, and everyone has a cell phone. He has a store called “Idéale Photo-Video” – Ideal Photo Video. He is married to a hairdresser and they have two children. This is his second loan from WAGES, this time in the amount of 500,000 CFA. He’ll use this loan to purchase more phone cards.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone credits for resale

loans.name: Holga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Holga ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a comprar y vender granos en el mercado de San Jerónimo vino canchón, La socia también cría animales menores y vende hortalizas en algunas temporadas La socia solicita el préstamo para compra de mercadería como frejoles, maíz, papa al por  mayor para la venta de granos secos. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Holga belongs to the "Virgen Purificada - Angostura" (Purified Virgin - Angostura) village bank and lives in the Angostura district of the Saylla province in the department of Cusco. She's twenty-six-years-old, and has a common law spouse and two children. She earns her living buying and selling grains at the Vino Canchón Market in San Jerónimo. She also raises young animals and sells seasonal vegetables. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, including beans, corn, and potatoes to sell in their dried form. Holga values and infinitely appreciates the loans she has gotten as they have allowed her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is seeking a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, including beans, rice, and potatoes to sell in their dried form.

loans.name: Juliver Gil

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El socio vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

El socio es ÉL Sr. Juliver;   él tiene 27 años de edad, El socio es casado y tiene 1 hijo El socio se dedica al transporte, él tiene un auto y lo utiliza como servicio de transporte; Este socio es un padre amoroso y muy responsable el desea comprar su casita propia y dar una muy buena educación a su hijo y poder tener una excelente calidad de vida. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura.” He lives in the Angostura district in the province of Saylla in the department of Cusco. The member’s name is Mr. Juliver. He is 27 years old and is married with one child. He works in transportation; he owns one car and uses it for transportation service. He is a loving father and very responsible. He wants to buy his own house and give a very good education to his son so that he can have an excellent quality of life. He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his car. He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since it allows him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He promises to complete all payments on his loan in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for his car

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El socio vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

El socio es ÉL Sr. Francisco;   él tiene 25 años de edad, El socio es soltero.  El socio se dedica a operar maquinarias pesadas, este socio trabaja en un empresa de maquinarias pesadas, como son los tractores y ellos se encargan de alquilar su servicio para arar la tierra y dejarla lista para una nueva siembra de cultivos de papa, maíz, entre otros productos que crecen en la zona; El socio maneja y da mantenimiento a las maquinarias, también tiene un molino para granos como son trigo, cebada y otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Francisco belongs to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” communal bank. He is 25 years old and single. He lives in the district of Angostura of Saylla province, in the department of Cusco. He works for a company dealing with heavy machinery, such as tractors. This is rented out to local farmers, for plowing land in preparation for planting potatoes, corn and other produce grown in the area. Francisco's job is to operate and repair the machinery. He also has a grain mill for wheat, barley and other grain. Francisco has requested the loan as fresh capital for the business. He is extremely grateful for the opportunity to further develop his business and improve his quality of life. He promises to make all his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as capital for his business.

loans.name: Sope Cheikhna Cheikh Sadibou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE CHEIKHNA CHEIKH SADIBOU est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont âgées entre 25 et 50 ans et se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe est créé depuis un an, les membres Kodé L. et Monique D. viennent faire leur adhésion et ont reçu leur premier prêt. Elles développent des activités diverses, à savoir le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures. Déguène D. n’a pas était prise en photo, elle était à l’enterrement d’un parent

Madame Khady G., responsable du groupe est âgée de 29 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses deux enfants (un garçon et une fille) elle a adopté volontairement 05 enfants qui sont dans des situations très difficiles. Depuis 2002 elle développe des activités diverses de petit commerce, elle vend de l’encens, des savons, du parfum  etc.  Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de profits et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses enfants tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Cheikhna Cheikh Sadibou is one of the community groups of the Randoulene Sud loan group, it is made up of 09 women all from the same neighbourhood. They are all married and mother to at least 03 children. They are between 25 and 50 years old and are organised by proximity and by affinity. The group was created one year ago, the members Kodé L. and Monique D. have joined the group and have received their first loan. They develop various activities, such as small businesses in clothing, cosmetics, fishing products and shoes. Déguène D. is not present in the photograph for she was attending a famiL. funeral. Mrs Khady G., the head of the group is 29 years old, she is divorced, and she lives with her two children (a boy and a girl) she has also benevolentL. adopted 05 children who are in great difficulty. Since 2002 she has been developing various activities in small businesses, she sells incense, soap, perfume etc. Her new loan will allow her to enhance her activity in order to increase her income and cope with her personal needs and those of her children while at the same time increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the group's financial self sufficiency

loans.name: Sergio Jeremias

texts.pt:
Sérgio Jeremias M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 02 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos. 
Saiu de Maputo para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha permanentemente na empresa Mozal como motorista ha mais de 2 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.800.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a sua residência e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Sérgio Jeremias M. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is single and is the father of 2 children, who are 12 and 2 years old. The oldest attends school. He only studied through the 8th grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house and does not support anybody else besides his children. Sérgio left Maputo for Boane in search of better living conditions. He is a permanent employee of the company Mozal and has worked there as a driver for more than 2 years. He does not have any employees and earns a salary of 5,800 per month, which he uses to pay for expenses. He even manages to save some in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his 1st loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (cement, stone, zinc sheets, etc.) in order to expand and improve his house. He promises to pay back this loan on time so that he can receive others. In the future, he intends to ask for more loans in order to furnish his house and and offer his family a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, stone, zinc sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Hermencia Alejandra

texts.es:
Hermencia de 58 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Ella vende encebollados (plato con pescado, yuca y cebollas) también vende tortillas de maíz. 

Hace 7 años Hermencia para ayudar a los gastos familiares,  decidió vender encebollados afuera de su casa en una carreta, poco a poco a incrementado su negocio, ahora tiene una carreta mas grande y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 11:30pm todos los días. Cada plato de encebollado lo vende a $ 1.80. 

Para tener mas ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una carreta grande. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
58-year old Hermencia lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, a part of the town where the majority of the people are poor. She sells encebollados (a local dish made with fish, yuca, and onions) as well as corn tortillas. Seven years ago Hermencia decided to sell encebollados from a cart outside her house in order to help with family expenses. Gradually her business expanded; she now has a bigger cart and works from 7:00am to 11:30pm every day. Each encebollado costs $1.80. In order to earn more money, Hermencia will use the loan to buy a large cart. In the future she wants to finish building her house and see her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a larger cart

loans.name: Sabata Jacinto

texts.pt:
Sabata Jacinto M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 15, 17, 21 e 24 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
Nunca saiu de Boane, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que Ja levantou crédito nesta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.700.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt foram para comércio e habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua residência oferecendo melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Sabata Jacinto M. was born in the Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is single and is the mother of 4 children who are 15, 17, 21, and 24 years old. All of them go to school. She only studied through the 6th grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anybody else. She has never left Boane. Sabata has had her own business for more than 10 years. She does not have any employees and earns about 3,500 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for expenses. She is even able to save some in her bank account. Sabata has had loans with other banks, but she later decided not to continue on with them. She found out about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who has already received a loan through this institution. This is her 4th loan, which has a value of 20,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to expand and improve her home. The previous loans were for 2,700 MZN, 6,000 MZN, and 15,000 MZN, which she put toward her business and her house. She promises to pay back the loan on time so that she can receive others. In the future, she plans to request more loans in order to finish and furnish her house, so that her family can have a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR SY est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont âgées de la cinquantaine et sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 04 enfants. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe est créé depuis un an. Elles développent des activités diverses, telles le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures. Les revenus générés par leurs activités commerciales contribuent en général au bien-être familial. Madame Awa M. pour des raisons de décès n’a pas pu être présent lors de la prise de photo

Madame Aminata Nialé Bâ, à droite de la photo vêtue de tenue rose parsemée de fleurettes bleue  est la responsable du groupe de solidarité, elle est âgée de 51 ans et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de sa belle fille et de ses 02 petits fils. Elle fait un petit de commerce bijoux, de tissus et de téléphones cellulaires. Elle mène cette activité depuis qu’elle avait 15 ans. Parallèlement à cette activité elle fait aussi l’élevage de poulets de chaire et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital d’investissement. Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois of Randoulene South ; it is composed of eight women living iin the same neighborhood. They are around 50 years of age and are all married and have at least four children. They have formed a group together as friends and neighbors. The group has been created about a year ago. The women are engaged in different business activities, such as selling items of clothing, cosmetic products, seafood, and shoes. The income generated by this business contributes to the well-being of their families. Mrs. Awa M. could not be present at the time when this photo was taken, due to a death in the family. Mrs. Amninata Nialé Bâ, on the right-hand side on the photo, wearing a pink outfit with blue flowers, is the group’s leader. She is 51 years old and has five dependent children. She also supports her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her business is selling jewelry, fabrics and cell phones. She has been in this business since the age of 15. In addition, she also raises broiler chickens. Her new loan will allow her to bolster her investment capital. She contributes to the improvement of the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening the business activities of the solidarity group

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Albertina Carlota S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 27 anos de idade que frequenta a escola de jornalismo. Albertina fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela. 
Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 15 anos na cidade de Maputo no mercado Mandela de venda de refeições e bebidas alcoólicas. Tem 3 empregados 1 para ajudar em casa e os outros para ajudar no seu estabelecimento comercial e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa, pagamento de empregados e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (PROCREDIT), mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que Ja é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tinta, areia, cimento, pedra, portas e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência oferecendo melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Albertina Carlota S. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is single and has one son, who is 27 years old and attends journalism school. Albertina only studied through the 7th grade; she did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her son and supports her sister who lives with her. She has never left Maputo. For more than 15 years, Albertina has had her own business in Maputo city's Mandela market, where she sells meals and alcoholic drinks.
