She has 3 employees: 1 to help out in her house and 2 others to help her with her business. She earns about 7,000 MZN per month, which she uses for household expenses and employee payment. She is even able to save some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). Albertina has had loans with other banks (PROCREDIT), but later decided not to continue with them. She found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is already a client of this institution. This is her 1st loan, which has a value of 16,000 MZN. She intends to use it to buy construction material (paint, sand, cement, stone, doors, etc.) in order to expand and improve her house. She promises to pay back this loan on time so she can have access to others. In the future, she plans to ask for more loans in order to finish her house and offer her family a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (paint, sand, cement, stone, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Sope Nabi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABI 1  est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont âgées de 30 à 50 ans et se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe est créé depuis un an, les membres Fatou D. et Kathy C. viennent faire leur adhésion et ont reçu leur premier prêt. Elles développent des activités diverses, telles  le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures, d’encens etc. Madame Oulimata S. n’a pas pu être prise en photo, elle était absente pour des raisons familiales

Marème D., à droite de la photo est le responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 46, mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est tutrice de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés  par des parents et/ou des proches. Elle produit et vend de l’encens. Elle est aussi vendeuse de produits halieutiques qu’elle achète dans un village de pêcheurs distant à environs 80 kilomètres de sa ville. L’objet de son crédit est de faire la promotion de son activité et son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, SOPE NABI 1, is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois in RANDOULENE SUD. It is made up of nine women, who all come from the same neighborhood. They are all married and have at least three children each. They are aged between 30 and 50 and got together as they live near to one another and get on well. The group was created a year ago, and Fatou D. and Kathy C., who are now members have just joined and got their first loan. They are building up various activities, such as a small clothing business, cosmetics, halieutic products, shoes, incense, etc. Mrs. Oulimata S. is not included in the photo since she was absent for family reasons. Marème D., who is on the right of the photo and in charge of the group, is 46 years old, married and mother to four children, who are in her care. She is the guardian of three children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives and/or close friends. She produces and sells incense. She also sells halieutic products that she buys in a distant fishing village about 80 kilometers from her town. The purpose of her loan is to promote her business and her ambition is to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote the solidrity group's commercial activities

loans.name: Julius Raimundo

texts.pt:
Julius Raimundo Chirendje nasceu no Distrito de Barue, Província de Manica, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 09 e 22 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa cedida pelo estado com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
Saiu de Manica para Boane cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatório. Trabalha no Ministério de Defesa desde 1980 e não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 17.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku pela simples curiosidade de saber como funcionava, mais tarde apareceu e levantou o seu primeiro empréstimo. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outros) para aplicar na melhoria da sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 40.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir um veículo para transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Julius Raimundo Chirendje was born in the District of Barue, Province of Manica, in the center of Mozambique. He is married and he is the father of 5 children between 9 and 22. All of them go to school. He finished 10th grade, but couldn’t continue his education due to lack of financial resources. He lives in a house that was granted by the State with his family and he doesn’t support anybody else. He left Manica to live in Boane after he finished his mandatory military service. He works in the Ministry of Defense since 1980 and he doesn’t have any employees. He earns 17,500.00mt a month, which uses for household expenses and, he even saves some money in his bank account. He never received loans from any other bank. He came to Hluvuku because he was curious to know how the organization worked. After that, he decided to request for a loan. This is his second loan for the amount of 20,000.00mt which he will use to purchase construction material (cement, stone, sand, iron and others) to make home improvements. He used his previous loan of 40.000.00mt for the same activity. He is committed to repay the loan in time to be able to request for more loans. In the future, he would like to request for a loan to purchase a vehicle for personal use.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, stone, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica, es el servicio de tejido y platillado, de las cuales adhiere poco a poco los tapetes tejidos, uniéndolos en capas para formar un diseño que luego serán utilizados como para decorar manteles o para cubrir sofás. Estos tejidos se entrelazan con mucho cuidado y por medio de una máquina puede hacer del tamaño que desee. Sus clientes son los microempresarios, que tienen mercado en el extranjero. En un inicio trabajaba sola, pero ahora  trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana, es así que puede entregar a tiempo sus pedidos. Se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza, puesto que no descuida su hogar.  Lleva 10 años en ésta labor, pese a que ha tenido dificultades de obtener la lana suficiente para continuar con su trabajo generando rechazar algunos trabajos, aún así desea intensificarse y por ello desea ampliar su negocio y adquirir máquinas mas sofisticadas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito, piensa comprar variedad de lanas en diversos colores, para que de ese modo se de abasto en el trabajo y entregue a tiempo los pedidos.
texts.en:
Madeline is 40 years old and is a hard-working mother; she lives with her husband and her 2 kids in her own house. She has a weaving and sewing business and she makes woven mats by putting them together in layers to form a design that will later be used as a decorative mantel or as a sofa cover. These weavings are intertwined with great care by using a machine that can make the weaving the appropriate size. Her clients are the microenterprises that export to foreign markets. When she started her business she worked alone but now her sister works with her as well so now she can fill all her orders on time. The work she does makes her happy, since it does not get her house messy. She has worked for ten years in this business, she has had difficulties finding enough yarn to continue with her work so sometimes she has to turn down some orders, but despite these difficulties she wants to work hard to expand her business and acquire more sophisticated machines. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that this loan will be very beneficial in increasing her working capital and for this reason she promises to meet each repayment deadline. With this loan, she will buy a variety of yarns in various colors, so that she can keep up with all her orders and finish them on time.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various colors of yarn

loans.name: Gabriel Moises

texts.pt:
Gabriel Moisés M. nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 2 e 3 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez nível médio não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta a sobrinha que vive com ele e seus pais enviando dinheiro para despesas domesticas. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo afim de continuar com estudos, mais conseguiu um emprego nos serviços Distritais de Educação e Tecnologia de Boane. Trabalha ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.586.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outos) para aplicar na construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua casa e sair na casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Gabriel Moisés M. was born in the District of Homoine, Province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique, a married father of two children of 2 and 3 years old, who are not attending school, yet. He finished middle school but did not continue due to lack of financial resources. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him and his parents sending them money for household expenses. He left Inhambane to live in Maputo in order to continue with his education, but he got a job in the District Services of Education and Technology in Boane. He’s worked there for over four years and has no employees. He earns 5,586.00mt a month, which he uses for household expenses, and he even saves some money in his bank account. He never requested for any loans in other banks. He came to Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan for 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others) to apply in the construction of his home. He is committed to repay this loan in time in order to access to others. In the future he plans to request for additional loans to continue with the construction of his home and to leave the house rental.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Fermín Sinforiano

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermín se dedica al negocio de vendedor ambulante  en varias compañías recorriendo con su moto, es casado padre de dos hijos menores de edad, vive con ellos y su señora, son personas trabajadoras.
En general él  vende ropas para niños y adultos, frazadas, edredones y otras mercaderías.
En ocasiones el deja sus mercaderías a crédito pero en mayor numero al contado.
El comenta que actualmente los clientes solicitan mercaderías para la temporada fría y por este motivo   solicita el crédito para la compra de edredones, frazadas, y abrigos en general como camperas, sueter y otros.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Fermín works as a traveling merchant in various neighborhoods that he visits on his motorbike. He is married and the father of two minor children with whom he lives along with his wife; they are hard-working people. In general he sells clothing for children and adults, blankets, comforters/duvets, and other merchandise. Occasionally he leaves his merchandise on credit, but most of the time for cash. He comments that currently the customers are asking for merchandise for the cold season and for that reason he is asking for a loan to purchase comforters/duvets, blankets and cold-weather clothing in general such as jackets, sweaters and more. The Applicant expresses his satisfaction at working with the Foundation and for the support given to his business's development and growth.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jeans, comforters/duvets, blankets, and cold-weather clothing such as sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Ivon De Jesus

texts.es:
En su labor de licenciada en Biología y química y con el apoyo de su esposo contador independiente, Ivon C. P. logro reunir un dinero para emprender  el negocio  de  fabricación de muebles de madera, Muebles J. y A. que hoy es apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace mas de 3 años, organización  a la que hoy solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 COP, para comprar materias primas como láminas de madera MDF prensada, para fabricar multimuebles encargados y pagar la mano de obra. 
Al principio Ivon cuenta, que se dedicó  solo a la comercialización de multimuebles y otros productos en madera y que poco a poco su rentabilidad la hizo pensar en una mejor alternativa como hoy lo hace, pues ella  diseña el mueble requerido, compra la materia prima, las lleva a talleres donde  paga   la mano de obra, entregándoles un anticipo de dinero, para que  inicien la producción  y cuando el producto está ya elaborado,  ella paga el saldo pendiente. De esta manera comercializa su producto terminado con clientes que ella consigue directamente, a través de su esposo o por referidos. Antes de entrar a la Fundación ella tenia problemas de liquidez que gradualmente ha superado y   porque su capital se encontraba en las cuentas por cobrar de los clientes, estaba en ese entonces su negocio estancado, pero con los créditos pudo despegar, así fue como al   recibir su segundo financiamiento,  logro activar su comercialización y consiguió nuevas posibilidades de inversión. En la actualidad rota sus cuentas por cobrar entre 12 y 30 meses y su cónyuge se dedica por completo a la administración del negocio, mientras ella como es educadora lo apoya parte del tiempo en ello.
A nivel familiar su meta principal es  continuar apoyado la educación de sus hijos y abrir un punto de venta para ser atendido también por su esposo. Su desafío  mas importante  se presenta,   cuando da largos plazos a los pagos de  sus clientes  y se han presentado algunos problemas  en su recuperación pero se asegura de recupera por o menos la inversión.
Ivon su cónyuge y su familia son personas muy felices ; su negocio esta ubicado en el centro del municipio de  Malambo a dos calles del parque de la cultura;   donde es muy común utilizar el sistema de crédito puerta a puerta como ellos lo hacen.
texts.en:
In her work as a teacher of biology and chemistry, and with help from her husband, Ivon C. P., an independent accountant, she has gotten together enough money to set up a business making wood furniture, Muebles J. y A. The Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has helped the business for over three years. She is now requesting a loan from the Fundación for $2,000,000 COP. The loan is to buy raw materials like medium density fiber boards to make ordered modular furniture and to pay for the labor. Ivon says that at first she only worked at selling the modular furniture and other wood products. Little by little its profitability made her think of a better alternative. Now she designs the requested furniture. She buys the raw material and takes it to shops where she pays for the labor. She gives them a down payment so that they start the work. When the product is done, she pays the remaining balance. This way she sells her final product to customers she gets directly from her husband or from referrals. Before working with the Fundación, she had liquidity problems which she has gradually overcome. She also encountered problems with the customers’ bills. At that time her business was stalled. But, with the loans she was able to take off. Upon receiving her second loan, her sales were stimulated, and she got new investment possibilities. She rotates her accounts charging between 12 and 30 months. Her husband devotes himself completely to the administration of the business. Meanwhile, as a teacher, she helps him with the business part of the time. On the family level, her goal is to continue supporting her children’s education, and to open a spot where her husband can sell also. Her most important challenge is when she gives customers a long time to pay. There have been problems with payment, but she is sure to at least recuperate her investment. Ivon, her husband and their family are very happy people. Her business is located in the center of the Malambo municipality two streets from the culture park. It is very common there to sell door to door using the credit system like they do.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials like medium density fiber boards to make ordered modular furniture and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Sara Amelia

texts.pt:
Sara Amélia M. vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. Tem um negócio próprio de compra e venda de roupa usada diversa. No empréstimo passado foi possível comprar a mercadoria que esteve prevista e a quantidade desejada.
Conseguiu pagar a sua letra de acordo com o seu calendário e o seu negócio tem andado bem ultimamente. Com o rendimento do seu negócio conseguiu melhorar as condições alimentares e de saúde na sua família.
O presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar roupa diversa usada para aumentar a quantidade do stock. O empréstimo foi satisfatório, melhorou bastante a sua vida, por isso pretende solicitar mais crédito para apostar na formação de nível superior dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Sara Amélia M. lives in Boane, Province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She owns a business where she sells and buy used clothes. She used her previous loan to purchase items and build up her stock. She was able to repay the loan according to the agreed calendar and her business has been very successful lately. With the great performance of her Business she was able to improve the nutritional and health conditions of her family. With this 20,000.00mt loan, she wants to purchase more miscellaneous used clothes to increase her stock even more. Her previous loan was very rewarding. She was able to improve her quality of life, and that’s why she intends to request for more loans to pay for her children’s higher education.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miscellaneous used clothes

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel Rúa M. vive tiene  dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 30 años en Palmar de Varela, Municipio  ubicado  sobre la delta del Río Magdalena, al oriente del Departamento del Atlántico ; allí se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir; ella aún recuerda cuando inició su negocio buscando su sueño de ser independiente, asì fuè como ensayó vendiendo productos de belleza y finalmente aprovechando su herencia empírica heredada de su familia, hace varios años montó su negocio de confección, donde fabrica  pantalones para hombres, vestidos para niñas, cubre lechos y otras prendas de vestir de acuerdo a la época y a lo que sus clientes le pidan. 
Este es su Segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización  con la que ha obtenido un cambio positivo porque le financiaron su capital de trabajo con intereses cómodos y un buen plan de pagos.  En la actualidad necesita comprar telas, repotenciar  y reparar sus maquinarias, razón por la cual solicita  un crédito por valor de  $ 1.900.000  COP
Su principal desafío es comprar una maquinaria avanzada para hacerse cargo de una producción mayor, pero María  debe esperar porque es un capital importante  el que necesita para éste propósito. Ahora su principal meta es lograr integrarse  a una hija a su mismo negocio y obtener una mayor producción y ella está a la expectativa de que esto pase.
texts.en:
María Isabel Rúa M. has two children in their 20s and 30s. She lives in Palmar de Varela, a town on the Magdalena river delta in the east of Atlantic State. Although she makes clothing now, she first started in business selling beauty products, pursuing her dream of independence. Eventually, by making the most of a little she inherited from her family, María set up her tailoring business. She makes men's trousers, girls' dresses, bed covers - and other garments, whatever is fashionable and whatever her customers request. This is María's secoond loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has develeoped a good relationship with this organisation because they financed her loan at an affordable interest rate and on a fair payment plan. She is seeking the loan of $1025 to buy fabric and have her sewing machines overhauled and repaired. Ultimately María aims to buy a more advanced sewing machine so that she can take on bigger projects, but she will wait as this would be too large an investment at present. For now her goal is to involve her daughter in the business and take on more work. María is optimistic that this will happen.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and repair sewing machines

loans.name: Cristino Raúl

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristino es contratista de obras viales, reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, es casado y vive con su señora y dos hijos menores, es un hombre trabajador y su familia lo apoya en sus  emprendimientos profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para adquirir una maquina que necesita para su trabajo el cual es un roturador de piedras.
El Cliente manifiesta que esta máquina será importante para   realizar un trabajo bueno y mas rápido.
texts.en:
Cristino is a roadworks contractor who resides in the city of San Ignacio. He is married and lives with his wife and two young children. He is a hard worker, and his family supports his professional activities. He is asking for credit to buy a jackhammer, a machine that he needs for his work. This machine will help him work better and more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a jackhammer

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe en Dios está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ellas es la señora María Luisa Días S. , coordinadora del grupo. Ella se dedica al cormercio de truchas es decir prensapalos, pirañas, collares, pulseras, colas, chapas, pañoletas, cintillos, cucarachas, trabas, picos etc. desde hace 23 años.

Sus compañeros de grupo son Pabla Emilda P. V. quien tiene una pulpería hace tres años e invertirá en arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite etc. y María Antonieta S. la cual se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The Faith in God (Fe en Dios) group consists of three hardworking and dedicated women. One of these is María Luisa Días S., the coordinator of the group. She has been selling haberdashery, including necklaces, bracelets, kerchiefs, headbands, tie pins, cloth diapers, etc. for the last 23 years. Her comrades in the group are Pabla Emilda P. V., who has had a provisions shop for the last three years and will invest in rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc., and María Antonieta S., who has been making hammocks for the last six years.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of haberdashery items

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia de 59 años, ella vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo vende cangrejos y tienen cinco hijos, ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se llama “bazar”). 

Julia comenzó vendiendo tres blusas a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar mas para venderlas, ahora ella pudo construir una parte de su casa y comprar papelería para su negocio, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm.

Para tener mas surtido el negocio ella quiere comprar cuadernos y bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is 59 years old. She lives in a suburb on the outskirts of Guayaquil, and runs a stationer's shop (or a "bazar", as it is called in Ecuador). Her husband sells crabs, and they have five children together. Julia started by selling blouses to people she knew. Little by little, with hard work and dedication, she was able to buy more things to sell. She works from 8am to 8pm. She has now managed to build part of their house and to buy stock for her stationery business. She wants to buy notebooks and drinks to increase her stock. In the future she would like to improve her home and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks; drinks

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, casada y tiene 3 hijos de las cuales comparte su vida a lado de dos de ellos y de su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la preparación y venta de comidas, desde entonces los platillos que prepara son los más solicitados por sus clientes, logrando aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Por otra parte, también trabaja alquilando sombrillas para la temporada de verano, eso hace que sus ganancias aumenten un poco más. En tanto su esposo es albañil, lo que le ha permitido edificar su casa, lleva 8 años trabajando en el rubro de la construcción y ahora planea techar y terminar de construir su vivienda. Olga se siente muy contenta con los logros que tiene y que pronto podrá vivir en su casa cómodamente. Por lo tanto espera se concrete de techar y dar los acabados que le falta y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para continuar de construir su casa, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa comprar bolsas de cemento y arena para terminar de techar.
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old and a hard-working mother. She is married and has 3 children. She lives with two of them and her husband in their own house. She prepares and sells food. The dishes she cooks are the most demanded by her clients, and so she has managed to increase her income. On the other hand, she also rents out parasols during the summer season, which helps boost her profits a little bit more. Her husband is a builder, which has enabled him to build their home. He has been working in the construction sector for 8 years and he’s now planning to roof and finish their house. Olga is very happy with these achievements and the fact that she will soon be living comfortably in her own home. She is looking forward to the improvements in her and her family’s quality of life once the house has been roofed and finished. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that the amount will enable her to continue building her home, and she is committed to making all payments on time. With the loan money she plans to buy concrete and sand to finish the roofing.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of concrete and sand to roof her house.

loans.name: Ana Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Liz   es casada, ella  tiene una farmacia  denominado El Pueblo, cuya venta es muy satisfactoria, generándole un buen ingreso. 

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia  están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esmero. 

Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  cantidad de clientes en ascenso, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de medicamento para la venta.
texts.en:
Ana Liz is a married woman who has a pharmacy called El Pueblo. Her sales are very good, and the business generates a good income. With the help of her husband and all her family, she is forging ahead with great industry and sacrifice. Today, she is a successful micro-entrepreneur with an increasing number of clients, thanks to the good service she provides. She is responsible and honest in meeting her commitments. She is seeking a loan to buy medicine to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell in her pharmacy

loans.name: Rosa Clementina

texts.es:
Rosa de 52 años,  ella vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tienen dos hijos y tiene una tienda de vivieres, hace aproximadamente 10 años con un dinero que tenia reunido ella invirtió en arroz, aceites y legumbres. 

Rosa ahora trabaja en la tienda desde las 05h00am hasta el anochecer, vende en su tienda arroz, bebidas y legumbres entre otros, pero para seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar cilindros de gas para venderlos, bebidas y cuadernos. 

En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, lives in a periurban area in El Fortín, Guayaquil. She has two children and she owns a grocery store. About 10 years ago she used some savings she had to buy rice, cooking oil and vegetables. Rosa is now open for business from 5am until nightfall. She stocks rice, beverages and vegetables among other items. In order to continue she needs to buy gas cylinders, beverages and notebooks to sell. In the future she’d like to buy a van for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For gas cylinders, beverages, vegetables.

loans.name: Tucán Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tucán está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas provenientes de Masaya, ciudad de las flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Digmara Elizabeth M. quien vende tortillas desde hace 10 años e invertirá en maíz, leña y cal.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Yaritza del Socorro V. C. quien vende frutas y verduras en especial melón, mamon, jocote y papaya y Luz Marina C. H. quien también comercializa perecederos desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Tucán group is composed of three hard-working, enterprising, dedicated women from Masaya, the city of flowers. The group leader is Digmara Elizabeth M. who has sold tortillas for the last 10 years. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder. Her fellow group members are: Yaritza del Socorro V. C. who sells fruits and vegetables, especially melon, mamón (similar to guava), jocote (a tropical fruit also known as Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, and Sineguela) and Luz Marina C. H. who has also sold foodstuffs for the last 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 58 años, es un padre muy amoroso, hace varios años enviudo, ahora vive en su casa propia a lado de sus hijos. El oficio que tiene es el de albañil, desde hace 30 años se especializa en revestidos de paredes y pisos y colocación de mayólicas. De esa manera sus clientes reconocen el trabajo que y por ello es muy solicitado. En un inicio empezó como ayudante de albañil y con el pasar del tiempo ganó experiencia, desde entonces cuenta con personal que lo ayude en las obras grandes y complejas de esa manera puede entregar a tiempo el trabajo. Disfruta mucho su labor, sin embargo a veces no cuenta con material suficiente que lo ayude en el trabajo, por lo que ha perdido varios contratos. Su mayor anhelo es construir el segundo piso de su casa y ofrecerles capital para que puedan trabajar sus hijas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficiosos para comprar sus herramientas de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa comprar tablones resistentes para  abarcar todos los techados que tiene que hacer, así podrá aumentar sus rentas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 58 years old and a living father. He became a widower several years ago and currently lives in his home with his children. He has been working as a builder for 30 years and he specialises in finishing walls and flats and installing majolica slabs. His clients know his work and he is in good demand. He started off as a junior bricklayer and he progressively acquired experience. He now has staff to help him with larger and complex building works so he can finish on time. He really enjoys his job; however, sometimes he does not have enough material for certain projects and because of this he has missed out on a number of contracts. His main aspiration is to build the second floor of his home and provide his daughters with some capital so that they can work. This is his third loan with MFP and is aware that it will enable him to buy work tools, so he is committed to pay all instalments. With the loan he plans to buy resistant planks to cover all the roofing he has to do, so he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy planks for roofing.

loans.name: Katiuska Rocio

texts.es:
Katiuska tiene 34 años, es madre soltera  de dos niños, de 6 años y de 1año y 7 meses, el primero de sus hijos esta en segundo grado de primaria.,ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, huevo, gaseosas, harina, sal, fósforo, etc) ella comenzó a vender  en el 2004 en el  Jr Grau, cerca del mercado central, pero por motivos de incremento del pago de local tuvo que cambiar de local.
El 2007 se mudo a un local ubicado en Magdalena aquí permaneció hasta el 2008 al culminar el año tuvo que buscar otro local ya que no le quisieron renovar el contrato de arrendamiento. De esta manera encontró un nuevo local cerca del Mercado Nery García donde hasta la fecha se encuentra vendiendo desde el 2009 ella menciona que tiene muchos clientes ya que brinda una buena atención. 
Los Sueños y las metas que ella tiene es que sus hijos sean profesionales 
Katiuska menciona que gracias a las capacitaciones que Finca Perú le brinda esta mas pendiente de sus hijos y que tiene mayor cultura de ahorro.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de huevo, aceite, azúcar, harina, arroz, gaseosa.
texts.en:
Katiuska, 34, is a single mother of two children whose ages are 6 years and one year and 7 months; her oldest child is in second grade. She sells groceries (sugar, rice, eggs, soft-drinks, flour, salt, matches, etc.). She started out in 2004 selling in Jr. Grau near the central market but rent increases for her location necessitated a move to a different locale. In 2007 she moved to a location in Magdalena and stayed there until 2008. At the end of that year she looked for another place because they wouldn’t renew her rental contract. This is how she found a new place near the Nery García market where she’s been located since 2009. She tells us that she has many regular customers because she provides good customer service. Her dreams and goals are that her children become professionals. Katiuska mentions that it’s been thanks to Finca Perú’s training program that she is able to better care for her children and has improved her savings habit. She will use the loan to buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice, soft-drinks.

loans.name: La Proyección De San Jose Group

texts.es:
L. SRA. MARGARITA (EN L. FOTOGRAFÍA L. UBICAREMOS SENTADA) TIENE 52 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE YA SON MAYORES D. EDAD, VIVE EN L. ZONA D. MARISCAL CÁCERES EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABYLLO AL IGUAL QUE SUS 1O COMPAÑERAS DEL GRUPO "L. PROYECCIÓN D. SAN JOSE",QUIENES L. ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA D. L. JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE CUATRO AÑOS SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR APOYANDO EN L. ATENCIÓN D. UN RESTAURANT, POR RECOMENDACIÓN D. UNA D. SUS COMPAÑERAS DEL GRUPO.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU HIJO PARA QUE SAQUE SU BREVETE Y PUEDA EMPEZAR A TRABAJAR HACIENDO TAXI, ADEMÁS PUED. CUBRIR SUS GASTOS PERSONALES.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN L. COMPRA D. ROPA PARA OFRECER A L. VENTA A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS Y ASÍ EMPEZAR A FORMAR UN CAPITAL PARA CREAR SU PROPIO NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita (shown seated in the photo) is 52 years old and has two adult children. She lives in Mariscal Caceres in Carabyllo district along with the rest of her group “L. Proyeccion D. San Jose” who chose her to be the treasurer of the Board of Directors. Margarita has worked for four years helping out at a restaurant, a job she obtained through the recommendation of one of the group. Her work has enabled her to support her son financially while he gets his driving licence and begins work driving a taxi. She was also able to cover their personal expenses. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy clothes to sell to friends and family, and in this way begin to build up enough capital to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio Núñez J. es cliente de nuestra entidad desde el año 2.008, está casado con la Señora Juliana Martínez, son padres de siete hijos, los mismos están domiciliados en el centro de Ciudad del Este. 
El señor Aurelio posee un local de ventas en un lugar estratégico ubicado en el  microcentro de la ciudad hace mas de 10 años, cuenta con casa propia.
Son personas trabajadoras, honestas, y responsables, y se refleja en los logros de la familia.
El señor Aurelio solicita el préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, harina, enlatados, fideos, panificados, y etc.
texts.en:
Aurelio Núñez J. has been a client of ours since 2008. He’s married to Juliana Martínez and they are the parents of 7 children; they all live in Ciudad del Este. Aurelio has had a strategically located store in a mini-mall in the city for over 10 years; he also owns his own home. They are hard-working, honest and responsible people, a fact that is reflected in the family’s accomplishments. Aurelio needs a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, canned goods, pasta, baked goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, canned goods, pasta, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasoles está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas. El coordinador es el señor Dismar de Jesús C. H. quien es comerciante de ropa desde hace cuatro años e invertirá en mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como blusas, camisas, pantalones, jeans, faldas...etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Patricia del Carmen García quien vende ropa usada y Ana Cristina Torre quien vende ropa y cosméticos en los cuales invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The group Girasoles [Sunflowers] is made up of three diligent, hard-working and decisive people. The coordinator is Mr. Dismar de Jesús C. H. who is a clothing merchant for four years now. He will invest in a greater quantity and variety of merchandise such as blouses, shirts, pants, jeans, skirts, etc. His co-members in the group are Patricia del Carmen García who sells used clothing and Ana Cristina Torre who sells clothing and cosmetics, more of which she will purchase using the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Pavel

texts.es: Pavel  tiene 35 años es padre (separado)  de un niño de 2 años, él inicio su negocio el 2004 en la calle San Juan de Dios pero por motivos que le incrementaron el monto del alquiler del local decidió buscar otro lugar  es así que se anima a abrir su negocio en el Mercado Nery García Zarate (2008) el trabaja desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde este horario es de lunes a domingo, por las tardes el se dedica a repartir sus productos de abarrotes a tiendas; el menciona que una de sus estrategias para mantener a sus clientes es llevarles sus paquetes hasta el lugar donde van ha tomar su movilidad Su meta es que su negocio crezca para así poder comprar un carro  de 3 toneladas para poder repartir al por mayor diferentes productos como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, huevo; también sueña con que su hijo sea profesional; El menciona que gracias a las  capacitaciones logro mejorar su negocio y también la relación con su hijo y con las demás personas que le rodean. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosa.
texts.en:
Pavel, 35, is separated and the father of a two-year-old son. He started his business in 2004 on San Juan de Dios Street. However, due to a rent increase he decided to look for a different place and he ventured to open his business in the Nery García Zarate market (2008). He is open for business from 4am until 2pm, Monday through Sunday. During afternoons he sells his groceries to stores. He mentions that one of his strategies to keep customers is to deliver their packages to them where they are about to take transportation. His goal is that his business grows in order to buy a three ton truck so that he can sell his various products like soft-drinks, rice, sugar and eggs at wholesale. He also hopes that his son will become a professional. He mentions that it’s been thanks to the training workshops that he managed to improve his business as well as his relationship with his son and with the other people around him. He will use the funds to buy soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson A. M.a sus 37 años de edad, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de edades entre los 14 y 28 años ha dedicado la mayor parte del tiempo en desarrollar actividades agropecuarias  como la producción de granos básicos en los que destacan los cultivos como el Maíz, Ajonjolí, sorgo y frijoles también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar, equino y caprino, dichas actividades le proveen a esta familia los ingresos necesarios para su sostén familiar y para seguir desarrollando actividades no agropecuarias como, seguir mejorando su vivienda, comprar mas ganado para aumentar su hato y proveer lo necesario para seguir invirtiendo en sus nuevos ciclos productivos, dichas actividades son realizadas en una jornada laboral de 8 horas y siempre que se deba atender otras urgencias de la finca son realizadas, este señor Nelson A. M.solicita este financiamiento para realizar la compra de una vaca parida la que le proveerá un aumento en su ingreso productivo lácteo al igual que un aumento en su ingreso monetario.
texts.en:
Nelson A. Moreno, 37, together with his wife and with his three children, who are between 14 and 28 years of age, has spent most of his time in agricultural activities like basic grains (corn, sesame, sorghum and beans) farming and cattle raising (cattle, pigs, fowl, goats, horses). These activities provide the family with sufficient income for daily support and to continue their activities like improving their home, buying more cattle to increase herd size, and providing what they need to continue investing in their growing cycles. These activities are usually carried out in an 8-hour work day although sometimes they need to tend to emergency situations on the farm. Nelson A. is asking for funds to buy a recently calved cow in order to increase milk production thereby increasing income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice, sugar, and vegetables

loans.name: Elbia Regina

texts.es:
Regina tiene 35 años es divorciada y tiene un hijo de 8 años ella se dedica a la elaboración de queques  y venta de productos de RENAWARE , la elaboración de queques lo realiza en su casa y vende repartiendo local por local; ella elabora semanalmente 6 queques y gana 4 soles por cada queque lo prepara de manera ínter diaria (lunes ,Miércoles, viernes).su meta de ella es llegar a tener una pastelería y preparar diferentes tipos de bocaditos y que su hijo sea profesional ella dice que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le queda tiempo para poder compartirlo con su hijo.

Ella también vende al crédito los productos de RENAWARE y los cobra de cuota en cuota. ella menciona que desde que esta en FINCA PERÜ cambio su vida ya que ella aprendió la importancia del ahorro.
Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de quequeras, cocina, harina, mantequilla, huevo, azúcar.
texts.en:
Regina, 35, is divorced and has an 8-year-old son. She works baking cakes and selling Renaware products. She bakes the cakes at home and delivers them to various shops. She makes six cakes a week and earns 4 soles for each cake. She bakes on alternate days (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays). Her goal is to one day have a bakery and make different kinds of pastries, and that her son would become a professional. She says she enjoys her business very much because she still has time to spend with her son. She also sells Renaware products on credit, accepting regular payments for them. She mentions that since she joined up with Finca Peru her life has changed since she has learned the importance of saving. She will invest the money in the purchase of cake pans, a stove/cooker, flour, butter, eggs and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cake pans, a stove/cooker, flour, butter, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Elbia Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 59 años ella tiene una hija de 34 años, se dedica al tejido de chompas de lana de alpaca (marca alpaandina) se dedica a esta actividad desde los 19 años de edad, teje en sus ratos libres ya que ella labora en un institución de promoción  agropecuaria,  estudio Biología. El préstamo que obtuvo  lo invertirá para la compra de  lana y palitos de tejer.
Tatiana menciona que la época de verano los pedidos de sus productos. Su meta es tener una tienda o un puesto donde vender sus productos.
Menciona que las capacitaciones que ofrece Finca Perú son muy interesantes ya que gracias a ello, ella es una mejor persona y tiene mayor auto confianza.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 59 years old, and has a daughter who is 34. Tatiana knits woolen sweaters of Alpaca (the fur of the Andean alpaca). She has dedicated herself to this activity since she was 19 years old. She knits in her free time, since she works in an institution that promotes agriculture. She studied biology. The loan she sought will be invested in supplies of wool and knitting needles. Tatiana says that in the summer, orders for her creations increase (for winter sale). Her goal is to have a store or a post where she can sell her products. And she mentioned that the training offered by Finca Peru is very interesting and that thanks to this, she is a better person and has more self confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ALPACA WOOL AND KNITTING NEEDLES.

loans.name: Georgia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgea está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ellas es la señora María de los Ángeles M. V. quien vende fresco naturales de mango, naranja, pitaya, cacao, de frutas etc. y tortillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años  e invertirá el crédito en capital de trabajo para salir adelante.

Sus compañeros de grupo son Miriam del Carmen M. Alemán quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura e invertirá en telas para realizar blusas y faldas y Paulino Aguirre R. comercializa sandias desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The Georgia group is comprised of three hard-working, determined people. One of them, Maria de los Angeles M. V. sells natural fruit drinks (mango, orange, dragon fruit, cocoa, and other fruit) and Nicaraguan tortillas. This work was implemented 20 years ago. By investing in this loan, you will help her succeed. Her colleagues in the group are Miriam del Carmen M. Alemán who has a dressmaking shop and invests in fabrics to create blouses and skirts and Paulo Aguirre R. who has been selling watermelons for six years.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, sugar and corn.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Reside en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene una casa alquilada, a base de madera. Ever tiene un motocarro, donde hace servicio de transporte público. En un inicio le fue muy difícil levantarse, ya que viene de una familia muy humilde y desde entonces aprendió a luchar para sobresalir en la vida. Es así que hace 4 años empezó a trabajar en una empresa de transporte, ofreciendo el servicio de chofer y de las ganancias que obtenía lo ahorraba. Ahora tiene su propio motocarro, por lo que piensa adquirir otro igual y con el tiempo forma su propio microempresa de transporte. Por lo general trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 de la noche y su ruta diaria son las localidades de Quimbiri y San Francisco. Sus planes a futuro es adquirir un terreno propio, para que pueda construir su casa a base de material noble. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por el buen clima cordial que existe. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un motocarro de segunda mano, con la finalidad de satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ever is 23 years old and unmarried. He lives in Quimbiri which is located in the beautiful rainforest around Cusco in a rented wooden house. Ever owns a motorbike taxi which he uses to transport the public. At the beginning it was very difficult for him to make his mark in the world as he comes from a humble background. But over time he learned how to get ahead. Four years ago he began working for a transportation company as a driver, and he started saving money from his earnings. Now he owns his own motorbike taxi and is thinking of buying another and starting his own small transportation business. Generally he works from 6am to 11pm, transporting people around Quimbiri and San Francisco. In the future he would like to buy a piece of land and build a good solid house. This is Ever’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is sure to make his repayments as promised. He is happy with his community group and the friendly atmosphere that they provide. With the loan he will buy a secondhand motorbike and provide his customers with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorbike

loans.name: Lupe Alexandra

texts.es:
Lupe de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres, desde hace algunos años atrás. 

Ella comenzó con su tienda desde hace tres años para tener tiempo con sus hijas, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, Vende bebidas, arroz, y todo tipo de víveres. Para tener el dinero suficiente y comprar los víveres tubo que trabajar con su hermana en otra tienda y después tener su tienda propia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y vegetales para su tienda y asi asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para un minimarket.
texts.en:
Lupe is 40 years old and lives in a semi-urban area in Fortín de Guayaquil. She has three children and for some years has worked in a small grocery store. She began with her store three years ago to be able to have time with her daughters. She works from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day. She sells beverages, rice, and all kinds of food. To earn enough money to buy the products she had to work with her sister in another store and later open her own store. She wants to use the loan money to buy foods such as rice, sugar, and vegetables for her store to provide for her children in the future. In the future she wants to have a place for a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, vegetables

loans.name: Bairon Angel

texts.es:
Don Bairon es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de tres hijos, casado, 
Trabaja en seguridad interna en una empresa privada, desde hace varios años, sus hijos aun estudian, y aunque su salario es  poco es un trabajo fijo.
Poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su casa, tiene materiales de construcción como: arena, Pero no ha seguido la obra por falta de efectivo, lo que con este préstamo lograra comenzar el porche, y poner el piso ya que aun es de tierra, lo que mejora la higiene, como una mejor comodidad de espacio. Para esto comprara: bloque, cemento, piso.

Contento por que a través de este financiamiento se la hecho posible mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Bairon is a hardworking man and the father of three children. He has worked for a private security firm for several years. His children are still at school, and although his salary is small, his job is a permanent one. Over time he is managing to make improvements to his house; he already has some construction materials like sand. However, he has never been able to afford to do the work. Bairon plans to use the loan money to begin the porch and put in a floor which at the moment is made of earth. This will help keep everywhere clean and provide a more comfortable space. To do this work he will buy cement, blocks, and flooring. Bairon is happy as this loan will make it possible to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, and flooring

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 26 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen dos hijas Noemí de 7 y Jimena de 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la  hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen una casa arrendada. Nancy tiene un Bar-Recreo, que esta dirigido a clientes mayores de 18 años, desde entonces su negocio le esta dando buenos réditos económicos. El factor clave de su éxito radica en el buen servicio de atención que le brinda a sus clientes, por ello ofrece bebidas tradicionales y exóticas de la selva, con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes. Su esposa la ayuda en el negocio, además cuenta con el servicio de dos señoritas que la ayudan en la atención. Su horario de atención es a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta esta localizado en su misma localidad. Con los ahorros ganados durante 4 años pudo comprar su lote de terreno con la finalidad de obtener su propia casa. Sus planes a futuro es abrir una tienda donde ofrece comida típica de la selva, con el propósito de diversificar sus clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además tiene confianza de que llegara muy lejos con su grupo comunal, ya que le ofrece muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para acondicionar su local, comprando mesas, sillas, artesanías típicas de la selva para que enchape en sus paredes, con la necesidad de cautivar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy, 26, lives with her partner with whom she has two daughters, Noemí, 7, and Jimena, 2. Together they live in the town of Quimbiri, situated in the beautiful rainforest of Peru, where they rent their house. Nancy has a cafe bar that is aimed at customers over 18 years old. Her business is giving her good economic returns. The key factor of its success lies in the good service and attention that Nancy provides her customers, offering traditional drinks and tropical drinks, in order to satisfy her clientele. Her spouse helps with the business. In addition she relies on the service of two women who help her attend to customers. Her business hours are from 10:00 AM until 3:00 AM and her store location is right in her town. With the savings earned over four years, Nancy was able to buy a plot of land with the intention of owning her own home. Her future plans are to open a store where she will offer typical regional food in order to diversify her clientele. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, which she commits to repay timely. She has confidence that she will go far with her community group, since it offers many benefits. With the loan she requests, she will set up her bar, buying tables, chairs, and regional crafts to decorate the walls, with the intention of entertaining new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, artisan decorations for business in tourism

loans.name: Laura Lizethe

texts.es: Laura Lizethe es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, este negocio es para apoyar a su esposo; con los gastos familiares como de educación ya que aun ellos siguen estudiando  para estar mejor preparados académicamente. Estos dos jóvenes son padres de familia lo cual quieren dar un mejor calidad de vida a su único hijo. Con este crédito será el segundo en esta institución; lo cual están agradecidos por el apoyo brindado. Para seguir teniendo mas ganancias en su negocio requieren de un préstamo para comprar ropa nueva para su negocio ya que piensan en un futuro abrir una boutique.
texts.en:
Laura Lizethe is a hard working and enterprising woman who has been selling new and second hand clothing for the past year. This business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses, such as education, because they both study in order to be better prepared academically. They are parents who want to give a better quality of life to their only son. This will be their second loan through this institution and they are very grateful for the support. They need this loan in order to increase the income from their business, by buying more new clothing to sell. They plan to open a boutique in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo Cliner de 13 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de San Francisco, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Rayda, recuerda que todo lo conseguido fue gracias a la perseverancia de sus objetivos trazados. Desde hace 2 años trabaja en la venta de ropa, por lo que procura siempre de mejorar en sus ventas, con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ganar una cantidad considerable de clientela. Sin embargo no tiene mucho presupuesto para invertir en su negocio, además tiene que viajar a la ciudad capital para adquirir las prendas a menor precio y al por mayor. Normalmente ella trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo. Su punto de venta esta localizado en el mercado de su misma localidad, desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda de venta de ropa, con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, así como captar mayor clientela. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y oportuna, además asegura de sentirse cómoda con grupo comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en comprar mercaderías que tenga mucha demanda, para que pueda abastecer su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Rayda is a 32 year old single mother with a 13 year old child named Cliner. They live in their own wooden house in the neighborhood of San Francisco, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuhan jungle. Rayda says that everything she has achieved was a result of perseverance and remaining focused on her goals. For the past two years she has been selling clothing. She always tries to improve her sales and over time has been able to build a considerable customer base. However, she does not have much money left over in her budget to invest in her business. Rayda has to travel to the capital to purchase merchandise wholesale at a lower price. She normally works alone, but sometimes she has the help of her son. Her vending location is located at the market in the same city where she lives. Rayda works from 7am until 9pm. Her plans for the future include expanding her clothing store and attracting more customers so that she can improve her earnings.

This is her third loan with MFP. Rayda promises to continue her payments in a prompt and timely manner. She says she feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank and all the members always support one another. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise that has the most demand so that she can keep her clothing store well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Wendy Santana

texts.es:
La señora Wendy Santana G. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de comida afuera de una escuela. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que obtiene ya que es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajos su responsabilidad. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en más variedad de mercancía y así tener un ingreso mejor en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Wendy Santana G. has been selling food outside of a school for more than a year. This business is her source of income since she is a single mother with three children who are her responsibility.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in a wider variety of merchandise so that she can generate more income from her business. She plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food to sell

loans.name: Dionisio Efraín

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio Efrain Gomez A. es propietario de un microbús que realiza viajes a león, Corinto, Chinandega cada día realiza 2 viajes, es soltero solo vive con su hijo que estudia en la Universidad, ambos se ayudan mutuamente.
El señor Efrain solicita crédito para realizarle mejoramientos a su medio de trabajo y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Dionisio Efrain Gomez A. owns a small bus that he drives between León, Corinto, and Chinandega. Every day he makes the trip two times. He is single and lives with his son who studies at the University. Both of them help each other out. Mr. Efrain is asking for the loan to improve his bus and be able to provide better service for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: La Señora Sara Biviana tiene 54 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento. Su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general su negocio se ubica es su vivienda, Sara tuvo dificultades ya que su casa de habitación está ubicada en un lugar muy distante por lo que perdió muchos clientes, siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima para satisfacer la demande a de sus clientes. El sueño de Sara es de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Biviana is a 54 year old married woman who sells general merchandise out of her home. This is not the first time she has received a loan. Sara has had difficulties because her house is in a distant location, which has caused her to lose many customers. Nonetheless, she always makes the effort to provide what they request.

This loan will be invested in merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers. Sara dreams of improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
La señora Natividad Julia L. A., se dedica a echar tortillas para salir adelante, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para la palmeada, es soltera, sus hijas viven con ella pero no dependen de ella ya son casadas, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega, y ella solo trabaja para su manutención.

La señora Natividad solicito crédito con CEPRODEL, para compra de quintal de maíz y leña, ya que no contaba con capital suficiente, lleva ya 28 créditos los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Ms. Natividad Julia L. A. works making tortillas to get ahead. She has the help of her daughters who assist her in shaping the tortillas by hand. She is single and her daughters live with her, although they do not depend on her since they are already married. She lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood and supports herself by her own work. Natividad applied for a loan with CEPRODEL for the purchase of a quintal of corn and firewood, since she did not have sufficient capital. She has had now 28 loans which she has paid back promptly and in the appropriate fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials (corn, firewood)

loans.name: Edwing Mercedes

texts.es: Edwing actualmente cuenta con 32 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en su propia casa, tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. El brinda los servicios de carpintería. No existe competencia ya que siempre brinda un buen servicio y trata de mantener a sus clientes pues les ofrece muy buena calidad en lo que realiza. El señor tiene proyectos de crecer con su microempresa y gracias a eso mejorar cada vez más su nivel de vida. El hoy está solicitando el crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, pega ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere abastecer a todos por igual.
texts.en:
Edwing is currently 32 years of age and lives with his wife in their own home. They have five dependent children. He provides carpentry services. Even though there is no competition, Edwing always tries to provide good service and perform high quality work so that he can hang on to his customers. He has plans to grow his small business and also improve his standard of living.

Today he is requesting a loan to buy wood, nails, and glue since he has many orders and wants to cater to everyone equally.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, and glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement, corrugated metal sheets and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gold jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente su esposo esta realizando internado  como Medico, tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad, ella actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres, cuenta con terreno propio el cual esta en proyecto construir. La Sra. Rosa tiene un vehiculo el cual lo alquila, lo adquirio con ahorro propio anteriormente estaba desempeñando su carrera como contadora. Ella tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder contruir su casa de material noble. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en areglar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. Her husband is doing an internship as a doctor. They have a three year old son and currently live at her parents’ house, but they have their own land on which they plan to build. Sra. Rosa has a vehicle for rent that she acquired using the savings that she had accumulated earlier from her job as an accountant. She has many dreams and goals, one of them being to build a house made of solid materials. The money she requested will be used to repair her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Marlon Emiliano

texts.es:
El joven Marlon Emiliano Es casado y con una niña de 2 años de edad, su esposa es Ingeniera Civil y trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace dos años desempeñándose en el cargo de encuestadora catastral.
De igual forma Marlon también es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace 7 años, desempeñándose en el cargo de responsable de adquisiciones.
Marlon Emiliano culmino su último año de la carrera de Contador Público en la Universidad de Occidente ( UDO León), por tal razón hizo la solicitud de crédito, ya que con dicho crédito cancelará sus módulos para obtener su titulo de Contador Público.
texts.en:
The young Marlon Emiliano is married and has a 2 year-old child. His wife is a civil engineer and has worked for the municipality of Chichigalpa for 2 years, performing the job of Cadastral surveyor (surveys used to document the boundaries of land ownership.) Marlon has also worked for the municipality of Chichigalpa for 7 years; he is responsible for procurement. Marlon Emiliano finished his last year in the public accounting track of the University of the West (UDO León). For this reason he is requesting a loan, since with this loan he will pay for expenses related to the registration of his professional degree so that he can obtain the title of Public Accountant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to the registration of his professional degree

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: El Sr. Alcides S., es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como jardinero en el Juzgado civil de las personas donde tiene 13 años de laborar para dicha Institución. Tiene seis años de laborar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado nueve créditos consecutivos para gastos personales como compra de bienes para el hogar, gastos médicos con lo que ha resuelto gracias a ello. Su último crédito se le otorgó para la compra de medicina para el bienestar de su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcides S. is a native of the township of El Sauce. Now he works as a gardener at the local civil courthouse, where he has worked for 13 years. He has worked with Ceprodel for six years, and they have granted him nine consecutive loans for personal expenses such as purchasing household goods and medical expenses, which he has been able to pay off, thanks to the loan. His last loan was granted to him for the purchase of medicine for his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Claudia Aracely

texts.es: La Señora Claudia Aracely Z. usara su credito para invertir en su negocio, quiere comprar una maquina para hacer Chorizo, ya que la señora desea prosperar y hacer crecer su clientela y que mas personas se den cuenta de los productos que ella vende. La Señora Claudia es una persona muy trabajadora y le gusta mucho su negocio por lo mismo quiere invertir y hacerlo crecer ya que sera el patrimonio de sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Aracely Z. will use her loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy a machine that makes sausages. She wants to be successful, to grow her client base, and for more people to know about the products she sells. Claudia is very hardworking and loves her business. She wants to invest in and grow her business so that she will be able to better provide for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a machine to make sausages

loans.name: Gudelia Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Gudelia tiene tiene 49 años de edad es casada  tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Cuenta con casa propia  de material noble de un piso ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Ella actualmente se dedica como ama de casa prestando servcio domesticos en Urbanizacion Santo Domingo, ella viene laborando hace 5 años para la misma casa. La Sra. Gudelia es una persona muy activa con muchos sueños aun por cumplir, uno de ellos es poder seguir construyendo su casa. Con el dinero que solicita  invertira en algunos gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Gudelia is 49 years old, is married, and has 2 grown children. She has her own one-story house, made from good materials, located in the Tinguiña District. She currently dedicates herself to providing domestic services in the Santo Domingo area, and has been working at the same home for 5 years. Gudelia is a very active person, who still has dreams she wants to make come true. One of them is to continue building her house. She will use the funds from this loan on some construction expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For repairs to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, zinc, and sand to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Jessica De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Jéssica C. L. se desempeña como secretaria comercial, la cual labora para un abogado donde tiene tres años de desempeñar este cargo. Ha recibido tres créditos de Ceprodel para gastos personales con los cuales ha adquirido bienes para su hogar. El último crédito lo solicitó para la compra de una cama matrimonial con el objetivo de tener mejor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Jéssica C. L. works as an administrative assistant for an attorney, a job she has been doing for three years. She has received three loans from Ceprodel for personal expenses, which she has used to buy items for her home. She is requesting this latest loan in order to buy a full-sized bed, with the goal of being more comfortable in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a full-sized bed.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Mrs. Myrna N. is from the village of Culo, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old and single. To make living, Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Her main source of income comes from selling her own-harvested rice in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than one year and is approximately earning 3000 Php a month.


She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in other business activities. She has a new loan amounting to 3000 Php taken from PMPC for additional capital for her business. This is her 1st loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 59 years old and married with ten adult children. To make a living, Teresita sells snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as down-payment on a motorcycle. This will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: down-payment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean T. is the mother of four children: one is now married with their own home, while the remaining three are single. To help meet the family’s living expenses, two of her daughters are employed: one sells cake and one is a part-time laborer. Mean T. has been generating $2.5 per day from working as a rubber collector on the plantation where her husband also works. Mean T. is concerned that the current revenue she and her husband earn is not enough to support them. She plans to make extra income by investing in a grocery store, but doesn’t have the money to begin this process. Thus, Mean T. would like a loan to build a small store in front of her home where she will sell grocery items.

loans.use: To build a small store in front of her home.

loans.name: Maluay De Curiqinga ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco Maluay de Curiquinga esta formado por un grupo de 9 mujeres que con su trabajo están buscando mejorar su economía y poderles brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, trabajan en el campo criando animales y también sembrando en los campos y su producción es para abastecer a su hogar, viven en la comunidad de Maluay que es una comunidad llena de vegetación y con unos paisajes encantadores.


La señora Patricia C. vive en la comunidad de Conchan del Milagro, es nuestra socia por el lapso de dos ciclos, tiene cincuenta y ocho años de edad, vive en unión libre, y tiene dos hijos, un niño de un año y cinco meses y otro de un mes de nacido, su esposo tiene dos hijos de un matrimonio anterior, el quedo viudo;  viven todos en la misma casa y Patricia los quiere como a sus propios hijos,  el primer hijo de su esposo tiene diecisiete años y trabaja, el otro hijo de nueve años está estudiando. Su esposo trabaja como albañil  para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Viven en casa arrendada.
 
La señora Patricia  labora en su propia casa haciendo sus Quehaceres domésticos, se dedica al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su hogar como víveres para la familia, el sueño de nuestra socia es tener una casa propia donde acogerse ella y el resto de su familia.


La Señora. María Consolacion vive en la comunidad de Conchan del Milagro, es nuestra socia hace dos ciclos y todo esto gracias a su hija que le dio el apoyo para ser una socia más en nuestra fundación. Tiene cincuenta y siete años de edad; es casada y  tiene seis hijos los cuales cinco de ellos son casados, los cuatro viven independientemente con sus familias, su hija casada vive en su casa y comparte los gastos del hogar, su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su esposo es albañil y así gana los recursos para poder sacar adelante a su familia y cubrir los gastos de la casa, afortunadamente han logrado construir su casa propia con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
