Nuestra socia aprovecha el tiempo que pasa en la casa para atender su tienda la cual tiene  dos años, su horario es desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche trabajando de domingo a domingo,  también se dedica ala cría y venta de  pollos de esta forma nuestra socia ayuda a su esposo en los gastos y necesidades que se les presentan cada día en el hogar. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir  su tienda,  su meta es engrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Maluay de Curiquinga group consists of 9 women who are seeking to improve their economic status through their work, and to bring a better future to their children. They work in the country raising animals and planting crops in the fields, the products of which supply their households. They live in the Maluay community, which is a community full of vegetation and enchanting countryside.

Patricia C. lives in the Conchan del Milagro village. She has been a member for two cycles. She is 58 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has two children, a son who is 17 months old and another who was born just a month ago. Her spouse has two children from a previous marriage, from which he was widowed. They all live together in the same home, and Patricia loves them as if they were her own children. One of her spouse's sons is 17 years old and works. The other is 9 years old and goes to school. Her spouse is a brick layer and helps support his family. They live in rented home.

Patricia works in the home, doing domestic chores and taking care of her small children. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of products and food for her family. Her dream is to have her own home for her and her family.

María Consolacion lives in the Conchan del Milagro community as well and has also been a part of the group for two cycles, thanks to her daughter who supported her in becoming a member. She is 57 years old, is married, and has six children, of whom five are married, and four of them live independently with their own families. Her married daughter lives with her and shares the household expenses. Her youngest daughter is in school in the city of Cuenca. Her husband is a brick layer who supports the family and covers their household expenses. Fortunately they were able to construct their own home with their communal efforts.

She spends time in her home tending to her shop, which she has had for two years. Her schedule is from 8 in the morning to 9 at night and she works Sunday to Sunday. She also raises and sells chickens and in this way helps her spouse with their expenses and the daily necessities of their household. She will invest the loan in the purchase of food to stock her store. She hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, meat, milk, cheese, and food for the family

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years of age and a widow. (Her husband passed away in April, 2010.)  She has four children, three of whom are working and one is still in college. Elizabeth has an eatery in her house which is near a college. She also earns income from renting rooms and has some support from her working son and daughters. Elizabeth has been engaged in this kind of business for 13 years already and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her eatery and room rentals.

In February 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to add to her business capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, savings for future use, and for future business expansion.
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza S. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 38 years old. Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn and rice for sale. Analiza has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns an average of approximately 2,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Analiza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 2,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her corn and rice production. This will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from PMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn and rice production

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang L. was born in 1968 and is a widowed woman. She currently lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She has given birth to three children. One of them is employed and earns money to help meet the family's living expenses, while the other two are students. 

Since 2001, Lang L. has been working as a sewing laborer in the garment factory and is getting a stable salary. As her old house needs repairs, Lang L. will be using all of the amount of the loan she has requested to mend it.

loans.use: To mend an old house

loans.name: Liza Claire

texts.en: Liza Claire L. is from the barangay (district or neighborhood) of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years of age and married to an overseas seaman. They were blessed with three children and all are now at school age. Liza Claire is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store (variety store) and a little piggery for her hog-raising activities. Aside from that, she is earning support from her husband through an allotment for her family support. Liza Claire has been engaged in this kind of business for a year and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from sales at her sari-sari store and from her hog-raising activities. In August of 2009, Liza Claire joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza Claire has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. Liza Claire is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to finance the purchasing of construction materials and the labor cost for the construction of another piggery building. This will be the second loan taken out by Liza Claire from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for the future, especially for her children’s education. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the construction of another piggery building

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Sarun Sanh, live in a Phnom Penh suburb, have been married since 1985, and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are garment factory workers and  the other one attends school. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for more than 15 years.

Sokhom has been selling meals in front of a garment factory for more than 5 years. She also was hired by her villagers to finish ready-made clothes when she is free. She cuts sewing thread. 

Sokhom asked for a Kiva loan one time already. But she does not have transportation and she very often spends a lot of money for traveling costs. It’s difficult for her to manage their income to support their family. So she is requesting her second loan in the amount of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito D. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his 4th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Bunnak

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnak N. (pictured here), age 32 and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Morn, age 28, have been married only since 2009 and have no children yet. The couple lives in a village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Bunnak has been driving a motor remorque taxi for five years. He drives goods and people from his village to Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh and back. (A remorque is a motorbike connected to a trailer.) Mrs. Sophoin Morn has been a garment factory worker for eight years. 

Bunnak is asking for his first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny R. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sarun Am, have been married since 1991 and have two sons; one is adopted and he is a policeman and another one attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers away.

Mrs. Vanny has been a rice farmer for more than twenty years, while her husband has been selling cows for more than ten years. Besides the business, he is a construction worker as well. 

Vanny asked for a Kiva loan one time already. She now is requesting her second loan of US$ 600 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 62 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her store. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Song-Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Song-eng H. (shown in the photo), age 34, and her husband, Mr. Heang KH., age 50, have been married since 1995 and have one son who attends school. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Song-eng has been a silk weaver for sixteen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished silk products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market or other places. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say S., 57, is an older woman and the widow mother of four kids. To earn a living, she owns a small store in a good location. In her shop, she sells different kinds of flowers to people who need to decorate for parties or ceremonies. Also, she takes time to order fruit in bulk to resell for additional income. Her children assist her in her business activities. Say S. normally earns an average of $3 per day to help cover her family’s daily living expenses. She is currently selling well because she has a skill in communicating with people. 

To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a $1,200 loan. She will use some of the loan as capital to accumulate a quantity of various flowers and fruits to sell. With the remaining cash from the loan, she will buy a used motorcycle for her riding needs.

loans.use: To accumulate a quantity of various flowers and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh C. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. He and his family live in their own apartment. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their two children.

Altansuh operates a shoe business in the city. He provides a wide variety of shoes to satisfy his customer's needs. He owns a stall in the market where he sells his products. Initially, Altansuh borrowed 200 USD with with a high interest rate to begin his shoe business. Working alongside his wife, they worked hard to quickly grow the business. 

Today his business operation is very stable. He has used his success to purchase a new home for his family. Altansuh is a modest, energetic and optimistic person. He says, “I had a serious car accident a few years ago, but I am happy to have overcome this terrible time in my life and create new success for myself. Now what I really want is to provide my children with favorable and safe living conditions." 

Altansuh is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a wide variety of summer shoes to sell at his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet E. is from the barangay (village) of Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years of age and separated from her husband. She’s blessed with four children, of both school age and infant age. Juliet was previously engaged in buying and selling bananas. 

At present, she is engaged in a bandsaw mill business with her live-in partner as the operator. Juliet has been engaged in this business for almost a year and earns approximately $330 a month from this activity.  Aside from that, she is still earning income from her banana sales.  

In 2009, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Juliet is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for purchasing good lumber and to buy another bandsaw mill machine. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for her children’s future education.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy good lumber and another bandsaw mill

loans.name: Bornohoi

texts.en:
Bornohoi B. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd, the western province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 1992, Bornohoi has been running a special order iron and steel production business with his wife and has gained much experience.  

The iron and steel products were successful so Bornohoi and his wife have decided to build a workplace in order to expand their business. They sell the products at the local outdoor market in order to attract more customers. They are in the process of building a sustainable business based on the experience they have obtained. 

Bornohoi says, “My wish is to purchase a container where we should make sales and complete workplace construction with the loan.” He is requesting a loan of 2,850,000 MNT in order to purchase more iron and steel from Urumchi, a border province of Inner Mongolia for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Dejidmaa

texts.en:
Dejidmaa M. is 46 years old and lives with her three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her youngest son and daughter are both students. 

Dejidmaa currently operates a small bakery in her town. She started a retail business in 1995 and just recently opened her bakery in early 2010. She makes a variety of breads and baked goods. 

Dejidmaa has found success in her new venture and has increased her working capital to a level exceeding 2,100,000 MNT.  She is a hard-working but easy-going woman who is focused on the future growth of her business. She says, “ I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future.” 

Dejidmaa hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and inventory

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. S., a middle-aged man, is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who appears in the picture above. She sells vegetables to people who come to buy anything in the market. 

S. has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently. The other two are single and work in the garment factory. Mr. S. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, he is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: 02.03.04-Hoang Dong-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lan N. T. (24) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Dong- Hoang Hoa.  Lan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.04 (02.03.04).


Lan is married and has 2 very young children.  To make a living, Lan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Lan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Thang (26) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Du (64) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Oanh (62) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Quan (63) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan N. T. (24) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Dong- Hoang hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.04 (02.03.04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 700,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thang (26) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Du (64) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Oanh (62) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Quan (63) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan A. is 37 years old and lives with her son in Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son studies in a local high school. Enhtaivan operates a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market. She began her business in 1998  with  capital of  30,000 MNT. After years of successful operations, she has increased her capital to 1,360,000 MNT.  

Enhtaivan has an open heart  and works hard to improve her business. She has many plans for the future and said,  “ My only wish is to be able to support my son to be a better person in the future.” She is  requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more diary products

loans.name: Rosita Sinodevilla's Group

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old, married, and has four adult children. Rosita is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosita S.’s Group. 

To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $45 a month from this activity.
 
In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma G. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Mrs. Hor H. has spent her life cultivating rice crops. She has a lot of experience in this sector as she learned the skill from her grandparents wH. she was young. She is now married and has six children; three are married and three are single. All of her children are no longer in school and they currently work at different jobs. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her.

Growing rice crops is an annual process with which she has had great success. She is able to plant and harvest crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. She grows the rice for the purpose of eating and selling as well. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, Hor H. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, she is looking for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland as well as to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mrs. Mely A. is from the village of P2 Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years of age and married to Domingo A., a carpenter, and at the same time her business partner. They were blessed with four children, all adults with their own families now.  Mely is presently engaged in buying and selling junk, particularly scrap metals, plastics and bottles. She and her husband have been engaged in this business for five years and earn approximately $220 a month from sales of their scrap metal, plastic and bottles.

 In 2007, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for their recycling business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion and for buying another motorcycle for business use.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for their recycling business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Ms. Chona L. is from the barangay (village) of Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years of age, single and blessed with one child who is now of school age.  Chona is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (general store) and a dried fish vending business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years and earns approximately $107 a month from sales at her sari-sari store and her sales of dried fish.

 In 2009, Chona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her sari-sari store and her dried fish business, and the remaining amount for a hog fattening activity. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion and for her child’s education.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Leonisa T., from Culo, MOlave Zamboanga del sur, is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children. To make a living, Leonisa grows rice,  selling it in the local community.  Engaged in her business for more than two years, she earns approximately earning 3000 PHP a month.  

Leonisa joined PMPC to gain access for financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engaged in other business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3000 from PMPC to use as additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S., from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 75 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in his business for over 10 years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 15000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan, his seventh, of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Alfredo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
The best territory of the countryside is located in Kompong Cham Province which is a good location for most Cambodia people to earn a living farming. One of these citizens, Mrs. You S. S., became a domestic farmer in the village years ago.

You S. S. built a pigpen where she breeds a few hogs and also sells them to a slaughterer when they come to maturity. She has also been depending on income from her husband’s job, who works in the construction field (he appears in the photo). This couple takes care of two school-aged kids.

You S. S. is taking out her loan to buy more piglets for her stall.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her stall

loans.name: 07 Thieu Phuc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nhan T. T.(56) is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nhan is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07 Thieu Phuc.


Nhan is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Nhan operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Nhan has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2002, Nhan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nhan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô T. Loan (55) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Binh (57) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Duong (58) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nhan T. T.(56) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nhan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07 Thieu Hoa.


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhan kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2002, Nhan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.000.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô T. Loan (55) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Binh (57) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Duong (58) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

Ma. Elena P. is from the village of Sicayab, Dipolog City. She is 38 years old, separated and has 2 school-aged children. Ma. Elena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including shrimp and anchovies in the local community. Ma. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Ma. Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Ma. Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Quyen L. T. (119) is a 30 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Chau - Hoang Hoa. Quyen is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa).

Quyen is married.  Her business involves raising cattL. for saL.. Quyen has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Quyen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Quyen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Quyen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Oanh (118) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  Hoa (115) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3.  Nhung (116) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Quyen L. T. (119) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Chau - Hoang Hoa.  Quyen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.01.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Quyen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quyen kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Quyen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quyen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Oanh (118) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Hoa (115) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nhung (116) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila C. is from the village of Sepaloc. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nila owns and operates a general store, selling household items and dry goods in the local community. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Nila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nila from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the business

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz has been a resident of the city of Raiwind for the past eighteen years. This is where her husband is involved in the milk selling business. Shahnaz is a housewife but she also works with her husband in his business and takes care of the buffalo as well. She has six children: four of them work and two of her daughters are still getting their education. 

Last year, Shahnaz purchased a buffalo by taking a loan from Asasah for the dairy business. This proved to be great investment for her family. Now she is applying again for a loan from Asasah for the same purpose. She is very hopeful that by purchasing another buffalo her husband will be able to fulfill the demands of his clients by providing them with quality milk. This will definitely improve the chance for him to make more money.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam T. is 39 years old and has been married for many years to Mr. Seng, 36, on the left of the photo. They have three school-aged children. This couple helps each other to earn money by working together as laborers in industry. They also always take time to cultivate rice crops for their food during the farming season. Nam T. realizes that she doesn’t have enough water for her needs because her house is far from the watering system. To solve this problem, Nam T. decided to pursue a loan in order to hire a laborer to dig a well so she can pump enough water for the family's use.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a well

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees lives in the city called Riwind, about 30km away from the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has two buffaloes and he sells their milk directly to customers, to earn an income. He also sells milk to the milk shops in the community. His income helps him to financially support his family. Balqees is also a very supportive lady. She helps her husband by getting the milk from the buffaloes. They have their regular routine in getting up at 5 o’clock in the morning. They spend time with each other and share the daily routine and resolve their problems. 

Balqees has three children: two sons and one daughter. One of her sons sells vegetables on the cart while the other works in a factory. Her daughter is studying in 5th class. Balqees has applied for a loan for the fourth time from Asasah to increase their productivity of milk by buying another buffalo. 
This will make it possible for her husband to supply a larger quantity of milk to his customers and to increase his income. Balqees is very hopeful for a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: 11Thieu Toan Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Tinh P. T. (18) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Toan-Thieu Hoa. Tinh is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11 Thieu toan (07.01.11.Thieu hoa).

Tinh is widowed and has an adult child. To making a living, Tinh raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising cattL. for saL.. Tinh has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2002, Tinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tinh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.124.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tinh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  H. T. Can (6) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Hue (22) is a 47-year-old woman who is also requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

3.  L. T. Nhung (59) is a 38-year-old woman who is also requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support his livestock business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
